programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: It's the day of Ormston's antiques fair and Jean's old nanny Ruby Moss turns up, but she soon becomes the victim of a shooting incident. Free-spirited builder Jack Lawler arrives to work on a new dispensary - arousing Nancy's curiosity when he flirtatiously steals a kiss. Meanwhile, chaos reigns at the hospital as part of the wall comes down, Deborah's flourishing romance causes upset, and Henry offers Logan a job. Drama, guest starring Jeremy Edwards

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Donald returns home with news that the local home for the disadvantaged is closing down, prompting one of the residents to move in with Deborah, closely followed by the woman's admirer. Jean gets a nasty shock when the tax inspector pays a visit, and Logan finally bares his soul as he contemplates leaving the village - a move which is welcomed by an angry Donald when he catches the doctor performing emergency surgery. Rural drama, starring Richard Wilson, Oliver Milburn, Jenna Russell and David Garfield

programme.title: Born and Bred
programme.desc: Deborah avoids Logan as his last day in Ormston approaches, while a surprise lies in store for Jean after she falls ill with suspected food poisoning. Phyllis is keen to interview Silas Craddock about his successful sideline in herbal remedies, but when the lecherous window cleaner comes into conflict with Donald, the pair agree to a duel at sunrise - which has a dramatic impact on everyone's lives. Drama, starring Richard Wilson

programme.desc: A distraught Polly watches as Abby is taken away by ambulance. Jan shares with Tom her fears about Lynne's infatuation with Frere

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: As the crucial final match approaches, Fisher asks Crabbe to keep an eye on the police football ground and look after an ex-professional player with a murky past - but there may be more to his new protege than meets the eye. Richard Griffiths stars

programme.title: Campion
programme.desc: Part one of two. Albert decides to get away from it all and visits old friend Belle Lafcadio, a rich art collector - but it isn't long before he's forced to team up with Oates to solve a murder. Drama series based on Margery Allingham's stories, starring Peter Davison

programme.title: Campion
programme.desc: Part two of two. An art exhibition featuring the work of a dead artist is disrupted when two bodies are found in the gallery. When Albert investigates, he and his colleagues are shocked by the identity of one of the deceased. Drama series based on Margery Allingham's stories, starring Peter Davison

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: A musical theatre performance re-enacting Brokenwood's history goes horrifically awry when the composer is electrocuted on stage

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: An ex-serviceman dies suddenly in the street, and Father Brown is called to investigate Danvers Retreat, a facility where the dead man was a patient. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part adaptation of the second of JK Rowling's detective novels featuring private eye Cormoran Strike. The detective is hired by the wife of a notorious author to find her missing husband, only to discover the writer has been murdered in a manner remarkably similar to a scene in one of his books. Meanwhile, Robin is caught between Strike and Matthew's hopes

programme.title: Strike
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part adaptation of JK Rowling's detective novel. Strike and Robin become suspicious of Fancourt after he makes a revealing mistake during a TV interview, while an encounter at a party leads to further suspicious revelations. The authorship of the fatal novel comes under question, and a literary analyst is called in to examine the test. Matthew is less than happy to discover that Strike and Robin are working together again, while Leonora discovers a mysterious purchase was made on the family credit card

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: In the tense build-up to a world trade summit in Edinburgh, Rebus looks forward to a well-earned day off - until Siobhan rings to say a body has been found in the grounds of the hotel hosting the conference. When a government minister is later killed in a fall from the castle ramparts, the abrasive copper comes up against Commander Steelforth of the SO12 unit providing security for the summit and, not for the first time, finds himself at odds with the Establishment. Julie Graham guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Peter attends a conference with Barkway, his old professor from Cambridge (played by Richard Wilson), and finds himself drawn into a battle over a set of research papers. Meanwhile, Lyle is left to his own devices and finds himself inundated with clients wanting to take advantage of his generous will-making service - and an office full of cats. Elsewhere, Beatrice is close to her due date and has chosen her birthing partner. Drama, starring Stephen Fry, with guest star Diana Quick

programme.title: Small Island
programme.desc: Part one of two. A Jamaican woman travels to London in 1948 to join her new husband, but her life becomes entwined with that of her landlady, who once spent a night of passion with the young bride's former love. Adaptation of Andrea Levy's novel, starring Naomie Harris, Ruth Wilson, David Oyelowo, Ashley Walters and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As Cathy Bradford recovers from the beating at the hands of her stalker, Gina Gold has no choice but to suspend Robbie Cryer, and as the rest of the team give her the cold shoulder, she's forced to turn to her Uncle Bob for help. Gabriel Kent makes a serious error of judgement when he goes against Des Taviner and helps a depressed and violent man get bail

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A sword-wielding maniac causes panic on the streets of Sun Hill, and the trail leads to a car ringing gang - with Gary Best's dad at the centre of it. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Eva Sharpe attempts to arrest one of the white youths suspected of setting a black man on fire - but in the ensuing struggle, her charge falls unconscious. Things aren't much better for Gary Best, who begins to wonder whether he has the potential to be as violent as his hated father. Meanwhile, Juliet Becker suspects something is going on between Debbie McAllister and Phil Hunter

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam Okaro launches an investigation into Eva Sharpe's arrest of Brad Kelso. Mickey Webb tries to smooth things over with Jack Meadows by helping Rachel with a difficult client. Polly Page puts herself at risk in prison by informing CID that her cellmate is plotting murder, while Debbie McAllister enjoys a night of passion with Phil Hunter

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Frances panics when Mother Mildred insists that she attend her first solo birth before Nurse Crane returns, and Trixie treats a pregnant woman who discovers that she has gonorrhoea, a condition that could have serious implications for the health of her baby. The Turners try to persuade Violet to approve the formation of a Brook Advisory Centre, and Lucille looks forward to a second date with Cyril

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Shelagh organises a ballroom dance to raise money for the maternity home, in the hope of taking her mind off May's impending adoption. A terminally ill patient laments that she will not get the chance to dance one last time, but Sister Hilda is determined to make sure she does. Fred suffers an embarrassing condition, and cannot bring himself to see Dr Turner, while Nurse Crane is discharged from hospital and tries to play matchmaker between Sgt Woolf and Miss Higgins. Valerie and Trixie are called to testify in a court case

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Compeyson comes closer to getting his hands on Amelia's inheritance when she invites him to the shareholders' meeting, confident she will need his assistance in running the business. Inspector Bucket makes a shocking discovery at Croucher's Warehouse, giving him enough evidence to arrest Fagin for the murder of Jacob Marley. Peter gives his savings to his mother after seeing her weep over Tim's poor health, and Mrs Gamp may have outstayed her welcome with Silas

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: Amelia shares the news of her engagement with Arthur and Jaggers, who both warn her not to rush into things with Compeyson - but their words only make her more determined. Honoria comes to terms with letting Hawdon go, while Bucket is running out of reasons for keeping Fagin in prison

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Black Candle
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama, starring Cathy Sandford as a woman who sets out to prove her husband innocent of murdering his shiftless brother. With Samantha Bond, Nathaniel Parker and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Sam's career is in jeopardy when serial killer 'The Good Samaritan' resurfaces in Great Slaughter

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: As the illusionist settles into rural life with Polly, they find their apparently serene country village is home to all manner of strange and disturbing undercurrents. A sordid sex scandal is about to break at the community centre, a humpbacked beast has been seen prowling around the vicarage and the prospect of a plague of deadly Japanese knotweed threatens to trigger widescale panic. Jonathan then decides to visit a retired psychic - who inadvertently makes the most baffling prediction of his career

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Just when it seemed the Creeks couldn't be any happier, a cloud appears on the horizon in the shape of a glamorous weather forecaster who leads Polly to believe she and her husband share a rather unusual and intimate secret. As if their lives weren't complicated enough, the couple's cleaning lady embarks on an evening with a hunky male escort, leading to a chain of events involving the disposal of a dead body and an act of teleportation that leaves even Jonathan lost for words. And what is going on behind the net curtains of parish magazine editor Horace Greeley, whose twin sisters Heidi and Laurel seem to be hiding a mysterious secret? Alan Davies and Sarah Alexander star, with Josie Lawrence, June Whitfield and John Bird

programme.title: Death in Holy Orders
programme.desc: Part one of two. Commander Adam Dalgleish investigates the case of a suspected serial killer and encounters greed and corruption, while also falling in love for the first time since the death of his wife. Thriller based on PD James's book, starring Martin Shaw, with Robert Hardy, Janie Dee and Jesse Spencer

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: With his friend in peril and a young woman kidnapped by the relentless serial killer, can Luther protect the innocent while preventing Cornelius's violent revenge from consuming him? Who is Luther willing to save, and who can't he bear to lose? Crime drama, starring Idris Elba and Ruth Wilson

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Reeling from the death of his friend, Luther races to save the others from Cornelius' terrible retribution. With Luther's increasing absence from the case, Halliday helms the hunt for a killer on the loose - a killer determined to complete his final macabre masterpiece. Thriller, starring Idris Elba

programme.title: Gracie!
programme.desc: Jane Horrocks stars as Gracie Fields in this drama about the singer and comedienne from Rochdale, who in the 1930s became the nation's darling and the highest-paid film actress in the world. Gracie's wartime struggle between love and duty and the repercussions of her relationship with Italian-born Hollywood director Monty Banks are explored. With Tom Hollander

programme.desc: Six unemployed men from Sheffield decide to become strippers for one night only in a bid to raise extra money. However, with no dancing experience and far from perfect physiques, the men rely on the unique selling point of complete nudity to impress the punters. Comedy, starring Robert Carlyle, Mark Addy, Tom Wilkinson, Hugo Speer and Paul Barber

programme.title: Gringo (2018)
programme.desc: Mild-mannered American businessman Harold Soyinka has to fight for survival when he crosses the line from law-abiding citizen to wanted criminal after travelling to Mexico. Director Nash Edgerton's action comedy, starring David Oyelowo, Charlize Theron and Joel Edgerton

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Holly Hamilton present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Documentary exploring what faith can offer during life's biggest moments. As Ali and Claire welcome their first child, Ali's family practise their version of the Muslim tradition of '40 days', looking after the new parents so they can be free to care for the baby

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell casts her eye over a two-bed flat in Battersea. Martin Roberts visits a linked-detached house in Winsford, Cheshire, and a property in Stourbridge, West Midlands

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts Thomas Forrester and Kate Bliss offer advice as contestants head out into the pouring rain in Shrewsbury to secure items of potential profit under the gavel, where auctioneer Philip Serrell awaits. Love is in the air for presenter Christina Trevanion as she explains how to flirt using a fan

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Claire McCollum visits the Corrymeela Christian Community, Northern Ireland's oldest peace and reconciliation organisation, discovering the story of its founder Ray Davey

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Mark Lane presents an appeal on behalf of Thrive, a charity that helps disabled and disadvantaged people to make positive changes through the therapeutic benefits of gardening

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages items at Witley Recycling Centre in Surrey, where experts take a look at a chest of drawers and an old armchair

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple find their dream home in Wiltshire, having already sold their London home, the pressure is on

programme.title: The NeverEnding Story (1984)
programme.desc: A lonely boy, neglected by his father and bullied at school, finds comfort in a mysterious book about a young hero's quest to save his world from destruction. However, as he reads the tale, he begins to become part of the story. Fantasy adventure based on Michael Ende's novel, starring Barret Oliver, Noah Hathaway, Gerald McRaney, Moses Gunn and Patricia Hayes

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich head to Swindon to meet Saima and her children Hamzah, Hamid and Zakir, who are rather embarrassed by their concrete jungle of a garden. Saima wants a zoned garden that gives her an adult area to entertain as well as a chillout space for the youngsters and has a ¬£2,500 budget for the conversion

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.desc: In Amboseli, Kenya, a rare event pushes a struggling elephant family to its limits. To save their dynasty, they must work together and overcome the challenge of a lifetime

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Adam Henson are in the thick of hay-making season, discovering what makes one of the nation's oldest crops so special. Charlotte is put to work on the Lizard Peninsula in Cornwall by a farmer whose family have been making hay for more than 500 years and also gets the chance to see how harvest activity attracts and excites myriad creatures. Adam is at a polo match finding out how nutrients in high-end hay are helping horse owners to get ahead, and Tom Heap investigates how marine heatwaves are threatening the sea life that lives around our coastline

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Ham House in the London borough of Richmond-upon-Thames, where an 18th-century robe could be an important piece of Chinese history. Other items brought in include a portrait by Indian-born artist FN Souza, a collection of silver from the Gulf state of Oman, two goblets engraved with images of the Crystal Palace, a dressing gown made by from a blanket by a German prisoner of war, and a photo album that documents the moment British atomic bombs were tested in 1956

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: The success of the Allied advance in Libya is undone when the Italian forces receive German reinforcements, leaving Stan and Rajib forced to beat a hasty retreat across the desert. Marga attends a maternity home and finds her commitment to the cause invigorated, despite an encounter with a traumatised fellow patient exposing her to some difficult truths. David is selected to fly a dangerous mission over France

programme.title: Pride (2014)
programme.desc: Gay rights activists gather in London for a pride march in 1984, and decide they have a common cause with the miners' strike. When their fundraising activities are rejected by the miners' union, they travel to a Welsh pit village to show their support in person. Fact-based drama, starring Ben Schnetzer, Bill Nighy, Andrew Scott and Imelda Staunton

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Big Little Crimes
programme.desc: An everyday burglary leads to police solving a series of dramatic ram-raids, and a minor report of theft leads to a case of kidnapping and false imprisonment

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle are at Longleat Safari Park, getting ready to welcome five Southern koalas that are en route from Adelaide in Australia. Jean Johansson is in the wolf wood to see if the European grey wolves can live up to their reputation for having one of the best senses of smell in the animal world

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph visit a terraced house in Stoke-on-Trent, a semi-detached house in Chaddesden, Derby, and a five-apartment building in Chatham, Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine presents from the Antiques, Vintage and Collectors Fair in Detling, and finds out how retro computers are becoming collectable. With Irita Marriott and Nick Hall

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the post-war British modern art movement in the seaside town of St Ives, the home for leading artists such as Barbara Hepworth and Terry Frost. At the Lizard Peninsula, Rick heads out to sea to fish for red mullet, and on the wild coast at Land's End, he discovers why Cornwall has a rather unusual animal as its national emblem

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor joins forces with his brother David and his uncle Matheson to try out landscape painting in the fresh air on the hunt for ways to relax that do not cost a fortune. A trip to an organised tree-top adventure park follows before they return to the family favourite of fly-fishing on a picturesque Northumbrian lake

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a dog-loving couple from Hertfordshire to find a High Weald home, and also gets to grip picking some of the local grape harvest

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses by joining presenter Dom Chinea at a life-changing training camp in the grounds of a arts-and-crafts house in Leicestershire. In the first episode, Morgan's furniture is beautifully crafted, but he lacks the confidence to really sell it. Cath's life-sized fantastical willow woven creatures are unique - but are they saleable?

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: New recruit Mark Hill joins Roo Irvine on a hunt for collectables around Scotland, discovering a tale of 18th-century body snatchers and the origins of British sign language

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Gina comes under questioning when Linda finds out there is ¬£200 missing from the Vic's takings. Anna decides to go through with her decision to find her mum and Freddie decides to look for his dad after seeing Alfie throw a party for Bert and Ernie. Stacey and Eve hatch a plan to find her stalker

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Photographer Brock Elbank takes images of Araf, Scotland's first Asian paramedic, who also works with local mosques and gurdwaras, equipping them with first-aid knowledge and providing a bridge between communities. Brock's photographic projects focus on idiosyncratic and unique features, such as scars, birthmarks and skin conditions such as vitiligo, to capture the private stories behind a public persona

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Thriller about a detective haunted by his brother's childhood disappearance, who becomes obsessed with the idea that his neighbour may have been responsible. Elsewhere, a family return to their rural Welsh home from London to be confronted with disturbing discoveries that have echoes of an infamous double murder committed in the area - and the possibility that someone intends to re-enact the killings

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: It looks like the end of the road for Freddy and Baba, trapped in a remote cottage by Lola, Jackson and a squad of armed response officers. With the trail behind them strewn with bodies, it seems unlikely they will escape the reckoning. Psychological thriller, starring Eve Myles and Babou Ceesay

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts an extended episode, with comedian Ivo Graham and journalist Isabel Hardman joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog and the squirrels go in search of a famously shy creature

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The clubhouse is inundated with ducklings

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: The Veggies and Supertato follow a noise in the plant aisle and meet a famous explorer

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun tries to restore peace to the farm in the guise of superhero Super Sheep

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Dennis is accidentally elected class president and is eager to shed the burden that comes with the title

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The annual town-wide hide and seek contest is held, but Girl points out that Boy is terrible at hiding and is bound to cause the family to lose

programme.title: Game on Grandparents
programme.desc: The winning teams return to battle it out in the Grand Final

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the aftermath of one of the biggest fires to ever engulf the UK countryside, Joe Crowley and John Craven explore the impact of increasing wildfires. Joe is in the Scottish Highlands to meet people who have been tackling a wildfire that has been burning since May, while John is in Surrey to reveal how nature reserves can be adapted to stop fire in its tracks. Plus, Adam Henson looks at fire safety on a farm

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Sweden v Italy (Kick-off 8.30am). All the action from both teams' second match in Group G, held at Wellington Regional Stadium in New Zealand. Sweden finished third four years ago in France, while Italy reached the quarter-finals. Reshmin Chowdhury presents, with analysis from Anita Asante and Jonas Eidevall

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter R, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters

programme.title: Sam and Shauna's Big Cook Out
programme.desc: Samantha Evans and Shauna Guinn travel to the small town of Deri near Caerphilly to celebrate the success of its rugby club, which has gone from the brink of extinction just four years ago to being crowned league champions. To mark the achievements of the players and the volunteers who run the club, Sam and Shauna cook up a huge venison feast with their help

programme.title: Caribbean Food Made Easy
programme.desc: Cookery show exploring Caribbean cuisine, hosted by Levi Roots, a musician who famously secured financial backing on Dragons' Den for his Jamaican table sauce. He demonstrates how to prepare recipes from his home country Jamaica, where he begins by rustling up spicy lamb in his childhood village and eating yam mash with the family of world-record-holding Olympic sprinter Usain Bolt

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The continued work of Australian naturalist Chris 'Brolga' Barnes, who has dedicated his life to raising kangaroos and is now opening his doors to new animals. However, it is not proving easy. The emu chicks are wreaking havoc, the camels are rapidly outgrowing their enclosure and the wombat is proving quite a handful. To help, Brolga is moving some of them to his 80-acre sanctuary - but after a clash with Roger the kangaroo, he has been left on crutches, and all his plans are on hold

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Profiles of handsome heroes and pin-ups of the silver screen, including Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Jane Russell and Marilyn Monroe. Narrated by Sylvia Syms

programme.title: Gentlemen Prefer Blondes (1953)
programme.desc: Lounge singers Lorelei and Dorothy embark on a transatlantic cruise to Paris in search of rich husbands. While Dorothy falls for a penniless man, Lorelei thinks she has found the millionaire of her dreams, only for his father to hire a private eye to spy on her and prove she is a gold-digger. Howard Hawks' musical comedy, starring Marilyn Monroe, Jane Russell, Charles Coburn and Elliott Reid

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Caitriona and Kevin thought they had hit the property jackpot after moving from a tiny flat to a three-bedroom house in Rickmansworth, Herefordshire. But as they have discovered, there is no comfortable family space downstairs, the kitchen is cramped and their growing twins squabble over who has to sleep in the tiny box room every night. Enter architects Damion Burrows and Lynsey Elliott, who come up with alternative VR solutions to the couple's property problems - only one of which they can make a reality. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents the grand final, with judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young kicking things off by challenging the sewers to make a Victoriana-style evening dress. These dresses require delicate fabrics to create the glamorous effect, but they are tricky to handle. Next, it's the sewers' last chance to show off their instinct for design in the transformation challenge, as they attempt to turn female party wear into a glamorous men's red-carpet outfit. Finally, they fit a Met Gala-worthy 'two-in-one' dress for their models, who this week are a friend or family member

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Gloucester as experts Phillip Serrell and Michael Baggott discover some rare gems among the antiques and collectibles brought to the city's cathedral.

programme.title: Brief Encounter (1945)
programme.desc: A suburban housewife meets a married doctor by chance in a railway station waiting room. Later, their paths cross many times until the pair become friends and their meetings a fixed arrangement. But as their feelings for each other transform from friendship into passion, both come to realise the affair is doomed to fail. David Lean's romantic drama, starring Celia Johnson and Trevor Howard

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: In an attempt to leave the men free for front-line fighting, Mainwaring and Wilson decide to recruit women into the platoon to take care of the more tedious tasks such as polishing brass. However, the captain loses his heart to an attractive widow, and it is not long before gossip spreads. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe and John Le Mesurier, with a guest appearance by Carmen Silvera

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Isa Guha presents action from day three of the Fifth Test in the Ashes series, which takes place at Kia Oval in London. The Aussies have already played a match here this summer in this format, defeating India by 209 runs in June to win the ICC World Test Championship

programme.title: Blur at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive performances by the band, from their first TV appearance on a Saturday morning show hosted by Cheryl Baker of Bucks Fizz right through to their headlining slots at Glastonbury. This collection features Country House, Parklife, Girls & Boys, Coffee & TV, Beetlebum, Tender and Out of Time

programme.title: Blur: Radio 2 in Concert
programme.desc: A performance recorded in the BBC Radio Theatre in Broadcasting House in front of a small audience of Radio 2 listeners. Featuring classics such as Popscene, Beetlebum, Coffee & TV, Girls & Boys, Parklife and Tender, as well as songs from new album The Ballad of Darren

programme.title: Blur at Glastonbury
programme.desc: Highlights of the band's headline set on the Pyramid Stage in 2009, which brought the festival to an end and included many of the group's most popular songs to thrill the Worthy Farm crowd. Actor Phil Daniels made a guest appearance on stage for Parklife, while the set includes Tracy Jacks, End of a Century, Song 2 and The Universal

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: A compilation of the band's appearances on the programme. First broadcast in 1999

programme.title: Hot Chocolate at the BBC
programme.desc: Compilation of BBC performances and rare interview extracts celebrating British pop group Hot Chocolate and in particular its lead soloist Errol Brown. The band's top 10 hits from the 1970s and early 1980s are showcased, alongside rarely seen early performances and cult fan favourites

programme.title: Portrait of a Lady on Fire (2019)
programme.desc: An artist is commissioned to paint a portrait of a woman about to be married without her knowing. She observes her subject by day, then works on the painting by night, but in the process, the two women develop a close bond as the wedding draws nearer. Romantic period drama, starring Noemie Merlant and Adele Haenel. In French

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Korea Republic v Morocco (Kick-off 5.30am). Coverage of both teams' second match in Group H, held at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. The Koreans were eliminated in the group stage four years ago, while this is the first team Morocco have qualified. With commentary by Vicki Sparks and Karen Bardsley

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Korea Republic v Morocco (Kick-off 5.30am). Coverage of both teams' second match in Group H, held at Hindmarsh Stadium in Adelaide, Australia. The Koreans were eliminated in the group stage four years ago, while this is the first team Morocco have qualified. With commentary by Vicki Sparks and Karen Bardsley

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Switzerland v New Zealand (Kick-off 8.00am). Coverage of both teams' concluding match in Group A, held at Dunedin Stadium in New Zealand. The Swiss reached the last 16 the only previous time they qualified in 2015, and the co-hosts are hoping to reach the knockout stage for the first time. Reshmin Chowdhury presents, with analysis from Laura Georges and Jonas Eidevall, and commentary by Jonathan Pearce and Anita Asante

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Scott Smith checks out the roses in the Picket Fence Garden, offering tips on feeding, dealing with diseases, and propagation, and explaining the differences in varieties. George Anderson is on the allotment in Joppa, updating viewers on the sweet potatoes he planted last month as well as checking out his pumpkin and sweetcorn

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Pizza Boys
programme.desc: Pizza chefs Jez and Ieuz continue their adventure across Europe, where they cook pizzas for locals in Bardi, Italy, before meeting one of their heroes in Rome

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode continues his alphabetical tour through the BBC's culinary archive, this time selecting recipes and ingredients linked by the letter H. Tony Allan and Giorgio Locatelli cook ham bone soup and Jamie Oliver makes a pine nut and honey tart

programme.title: Live Triathlon
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers presents live coverage of day two of the sixth round of the campaign, featuring the elite mixed relay. Germany won this race on home territory in the previous race in Hamburg, with New Zealand claiming silver and Switzerland bronze

programme.title: The Championship
programme.desc: Dublin v Kerry (Throw-in 3.30pm). Sarah Mulkerrins presents coverage of the showpiece match at Croke Park. Holders Kerry defeated Derry in the last four, while Dublin overcame Monaghan and are looking to win this trophy for the first time since they prevailed for the sixth year in a row in 2020. With analysis from Mickey Harte, Oisin McConville and Michael Murphy, commentary by Thomas Niblock and Philly McMahon, and commentary by Orla Bannon

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and experts Mark Stacey, Anita Manning and David Fletcher are at Tatton Park in Cheshire to assess items brought in by the public

programme.title: What They Really Mean For You
programme.desc: Michelle Ackerley presents the first of two programmes exploring aspects of modern life that need to change to protect the environment, which focuses on the switch to electric cars. The programme explores the obstacles in electric vehicles becoming the standard, from cost to the difficulty of charging, while BBC Climate Editor Justin Rowlatt explores if the UK is on track to hit the government's targets to stop emitting greenhouse gases by 2050

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Isa Guha presents action from day four of the Fifth Test in the Ashes series, which takes place at Kia Oval in London. The last meeting between the sides here in this format saw England prevail by 135 runs in 2019, ensuring the series ended in a 2-2 draw

programme.title: Earth's Tropical Islands
programme.desc: Exploring the flora and fauna of the island, which has given rise to more unique plants and animals, from its lemurs to chameleons, than any other on Earth

programme.title: Louis Theroux's Forbidden America
programme.desc: The film-maker returns to the US to explore the impact of the internet and social media on some of the most controversial corners of American society. He begins by meeting the new influencers of the far-right who are promoting an ideology that is defiantly racist, misogynistic, homophobic and anti-Semitic, often packaging the most extreme views as 'irony'. Louis attempts to understand their recent surge in popularity and challenges the divisive rhetoric that is being streamed to millions of young viewers online

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian visits Bosnia and Herzegovina to discover how this small corner of Eastern Europe has changed since the war, with the aid of a local museum curator. He tries out Sarajevo's abandoned bobsleigh track, a remnant of the 1984 winter Olympics, stays in a 'war hostel', and meets a man who claims to have discovered the world's largest pyramid

programme.title: Memento (2000)
programme.desc: An insurance investigator suffers from short-term memory loss after an attack in which his wife was also raped and murdered. Unable to remember events for more than a few minutes, he is determined to track down the killer and relies on copious note-taking and reminders tattooed on his body to aid his mission. Christopher Nolan's thriller, starring Guy Pearce, Carrie-Anne Moss, Joe Pantoliano and Mark Boone Jr

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: The chef lifts the lid on the industry, revealing how it operates and meeting the skilled and passionate experts driving it forward. In this first episode, he explores the highly skilled and competitive world of fine dining. Tom chats to professionals who, like him, are obsessed with the pursuit of culinary excellence, including Lake District-based chef Ryan Blackburn

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Documentary examining the life of the actress, beginning as aspiring star Norma Jeane Baker attends an audition at 20th Century Fox, where the head of casting suggests she change her name to Marilyn Monroe. After connecting with Joseph Schenck, Marilyn is able to get a job at Columbia Pictures, where she receives her first starring role. Narrated by Jessica Chastain

programme.title: Reframed: Marilyn Monroe
programme.desc: Marilyn's rise is nearly ruined when news breaks that she posed nude for a calendar earlier in her career. She uses this to her advantage to showcase her body confidence. Monroe also demonstrates her unique talent for comedy in Gentlemen Prefer Blondes, and reaches superstar status

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don harvests his potatoes and sows seeds for autumn vegetables. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings. Adam Frost meets a couple who have spent decades creating a garden on the exposed chalk hills of the Yorkshire Wolds and Sue Kent refreshes her garden to extend the colour and interest into late summer and autumn. Gardeners working in an extraordinary location on the edge of cliffs in Penzance reveal the wind-swept challenges they face and viewers meet a Sussex gardener who has taken the idea of outdoor living to a whole new level

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Scott Smith checks out the roses in the Picket Fence Garden, offering tips on feeding, dealing with diseases, and propagation, and explaining the differences in varieties. George Anderson is on the allotment in Joppa, updating viewers on the sweet potatoes he planted last month as well as checking out his pumpkin and sweetcorn

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader submerges himself in the famous hot springs of Saturnia. He also joins Italy's last surviving cowboys, known as the Butteri, to learn how to lasso and barbecue the perfect steak

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins the latest leg on the seafront at Felixstowe, where in January 1953 the town was engulfed in the worst flooding to hit England in the 20th century. In Norwich, he admires the Norman Cathedral, then traces the history of the postcode

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Canada v Australia (Kick-off 11.00am). All the action from both teams' third and final match in Group B, held at Melbourne Rectangular Stadium in Australia. The co-hosts know that a victory will see them qualify for the knockout stage, while a draw would mean they require a victory for Republic of Ireland over Nigeria in order for them to progress, and a loss would result in elimination. Gabby Logan presents, with analysis by Steph Houghton and Rachel Brown-Finnis, and commentary by Robyn Cowen and Anita Asante

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win ¬£10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Kenneth Williams, UK hit singles 2000-2004, Ada Lovelace, and the Rugby World Cup, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two returnees and a newcomer make their way to the kitchen for the Scotland heats, preparing their starters and fish courses. Gordon Jones presents a risky starter which combines raw mackerel and porridge, inspired by childhood memories spent fishing, while Lorna McNee offers a new twist on the classic snack, cheese on toast. For his fish course, Ben Reade decides to showcase halibut as a tribute to his favourite DJ, John Peel

programme.title: World's Sneakiest Animals
programme.desc: Naturalist Chris Packham observes the devious tactics and sneaky tricks that some animals carry out in order to survive. New, ground-breaking science helps reveal astonishing visual trickery, from illusionist zebras to vanishing geckos and shape-shifting cuttlefish. Mischievous mimics, from snakes to baby birds disguised as caterpillars, and a lioness who looks like a male lion are also highlighted. The world's ultimate con artists can even rely on sneaky strategies against their own kind, such as the monkey that cheats its family and the lizard that fakes its death

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Pig farmers Morgan and Tasha take their Duroc pigs to compete for their first time in the Royal Welsh Show, while seasoned competitor Amanda is desperate to win a rosette to seal her reputation as a pedigree breeder. Show day brings the hottest temperature ever recorded in Wales and the farmers have to get creative to keep the pigs cool and comfortable

programme.title: Netball World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Jeanette Kwakye presents coverage of a match from the second group stage (Centre-pass 5.00pm), held at Cape Town International Convention Centre in South Africa. England, Scotland and Wales had all qualified for this tournament, with England expected to reach this stage after finishing third in 2019. With analysis from Ama Agbeze

programme.title: Today at the Test
programme.desc: England v Australia. Isa Guha presents action from day five of the Fifth Test, as the Ashes series concluded at Kia Oval in London. While England's overall Test match record has been inconsistent here in recent years, they have had the better of things against the Aussies, winning five of the last 10 contests dating back to 1985, while Australia have only won twice

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts another first-round match as devotees of choral music the Antiphons take on red wine connoisseurs Drop of Red. The teams must use patience, lateral thinking and sheer inspiration to make connections between four things that may appear at first not to be linked, with one set of clues comprising Beautiful Horizon, Joyful Port, Saint Paul, and River of January

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the third of the academic quiz's first-round matches, four students from Birkbeck, University of London pit their wits against a team from Oxford Brookes University in a bid to reach the second stage of the competition. Amol Rajan asks the questions

programme.title: Earth
programme.desc: Chris Packham tells the story of how plant life turned Earth from a barren rock into a vibrant green world - a 4.5 billion-year saga of extraordinary highs and lows that almost wiped out all life. He reveals how a giant asteroid bombardment triggered Earth's plate tectonics, leading to huge fungi, soil and giant swamp forests, but the early plants locked in so much carbon dioxide that global temperatures suddenly plunged

programme.title: Naked Video
programme.desc: Comedy sketch show featuring characters including Siadwel, the Bald Man, Helen in the Wine Bar and Rab C Nesbitt. Starring Gregor Fisher, Elaine C Smith, Andy Gray, Tony Roper, Helen Lederer, Jonathan Watson and John Sparkes. First shown in 1989

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: On the Basis of Sex (2018)
programme.desc: Biopic of lawyer Ruth Bader Ginsburg showing how she faced adversity and numerous obstacles in her fight for equal rights throughout her career, which culminated in her becoming a member of the Supreme Court of the United States. Starring Felicity Jones, with Armie Hammer, Justin Theroux and Kathy Bates

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: In the aftermath of one of the biggest fires to ever engulf the UK countryside, Joe Crowley and John Craven explore the impact of increasing wildfires. Joe is in the Scottish Highlands to meet people who have been tackling a wildfire that has been burning since May, while John is in Surrey to reveal how nature reserves can be adapted to stop fire in its tracks. Plus, Adam Henson looks at fire safety on a farm

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore explores Beaconsfield recycling centre in Buckinghamshire, determined to save quality items from being crushed. There's a sliding door sideboard for furniture painter Chloe Kempster and a collection of wooden skis for lighting designer Duncan McKean. Sarah herself gets crafty with a collection of knitted blankets and patches. Narrated by Arthur Smith

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The story of keen sailor Natasha Lambert, who has cerebral palsy. Natasha cannot use her arms or legs, so her father invented a system that would enable her to control a boat by breathing in and out of a straw. First, she sailed the Solent and then traversed the English Channel. Each time her challenges got bigger and bigger. Now, Natasha wants to control a 46-ft yacht across the Atlantic. This documentary charts a family determined to enable Natasha to fulfil her dream, illustrating how her ambition has inspired all of them

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Our Coast
programme.desc: Adrian Chiles and Mehreen Baig explore Anglesey, the largest island in the Irish Sea. Mehreen recalls the story of the Menai Strait's magnificent bridges, while Adrian dons a wet suit to meet local paddleboarding legend Sian Sykes and see how she's playing a key role in helping rid the island of waste plastic. Plus, comedian Tudur Owen fulfils a boyhood dream by joining the Holyhead truckers at their brand new truck stop, Lucy Martin explores the shipwreck that changed the way weather is forecast and wildlife expert Patrick Ayree gets up close to the wild ponies of Newborough Warren

programme.title: How the Wild West Was Won with Ray Mears
programme.desc: How the landscapes of America's five great deserts challenged the pioneers' westward push. Beginning in Monument Valley on the Arizona-Utah state line, Ray discovers how the US cavalry struggled in the hot arid landscape, explores how the Apache adapted their warfare methods to the hostile conditions and reveals why the forbidding landscape proved the perfect refuge for bandits

programme.title: Clean Sweep
programme.desc: Housewife and mother-of-three Shelly Mohan is married to a Galway detective, but finds her humdrum existence is thrown into turmoil when a man from her distant past resurfaces and threatens to expose her former life. Crime thriller, starring Charlene McKenna

programme.title: Clean Sweep
programme.desc: Shelly's husband Jason is delighted to be assigned to the case, with no sense where the trail may lead. While he and his colleague Fiona focus on a sex worker, Shelly realises she may have left evidence in the dead man's hotel room. Crime thriller, starring Charlene McKenna

programme.title: This Is Joan Collins
programme.desc: The actress reflects on her life and career, looking back on her rollercoaster seven decades in showbusiness and sharing footage from her home archive. Against a backdrop of Collins' own narration, her story showcases the extraordinary life of a woman who has lived through the glitz, the glamour and the enduring moments of Hollywood history, and survived it all with panache

programme.title: John Le Mesurier: It's All Been Rather Lovely
programme.desc: A portrait of the prolific actor's life and career, from his turbulent marriage to Hattie Jacques to his renowned role as Sgt Wilson in the TV sitcom Dad's Army and parts in more than 100 films. Featuring contributions by Michael Palin, Clive Dunn, Ian Lavender, Jimmy Perry and Joan Le Mesurier. Narrated by Julian Rhind-Tutt

programme.title: Hancock's Half Hour
programme.desc: Tony causes chaos on a cruise and has to be locked up when he convinces himself the ship is sinking. With Tony Hancock, Sidney James and Hattie Jacques

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: As Bob's wedding day dawns, a frustrated Terry continues to wreak havoc on people who happen to be unfortunate enough to live near him. Comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam

programme.title: Our Coast
programme.desc: Adrian Chiles and Mehreen Baig explore Anglesey, the largest island in the Irish Sea. Mehreen recalls the story of the Menai Strait's magnificent bridges, while Adrian dons a wet suit to meet local paddleboarding legend Sian Sykes and see how she's playing a key role in helping rid the island of waste plastic. Plus, comedian Tudur Owen fulfils a boyhood dream by joining the Holyhead truckers at their brand new truck stop, Lucy Martin explores the shipwreck that changed the way weather is forecast and wildlife expert Patrick Ayree gets up close to the wild ponies of Newborough Warren

programme.title: Sir Simon Rattle at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of the conductor's finest performances from the BBC archive, featuring his work at the BBC Proms and demonstrating love of contemporary music

programme.title: Bomsori Plays Bruch at the Proms
programme.desc: South Korean virtuoso Bomsori performs Bruch's First Violin Concerto with the BBC Philharmonic, conducted by Anja Bihlmaier, in an evening of music inspired by the folk traditions of Hungary. Katya Adler is joined by composer and cellist Ayanna Witter-Johnson to discuss the enduring power of folk in a concert also featuring Brahms' Hungarian Dances and Bartok's Concerto for Orchestra. There's also a welcome return to the Proms, after almost a century, of the piece that launched the career of Croydon-based British composer, Samuel Coleridge-Taylor

programme.title: Being Beethoven
programme.desc: As the composer embarked on the extraordinary flowering of his late music, his health deteriorated and his desire for love and family tipped over into obsession. Musical highlights include Paul Lewis exploring the beauty and brutality of the Diabelli Variations, and the Takacs Quartet playing the Hymn of Thanksgiving from Op 132

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Jacob Bronowski considers the new skills that were required when nomads began settling in townships, leading to the development of science, in the form of architecture. Bronowski looks at examples including the Inca cities in the high Andes, the Roman aqueducts in Spain and the great cathedrals of medieval France as he looks at how mankind uncovered the laws of nature in the stone. First shown in 1973

programme.title: The Ascent of Man
programme.desc: Dr Jacob Bronowski traces the evolution of chemistry, from the techniques of ancient metallurgy in China and Japan to the mystical searchings of the alchemists and Dalton's atomic theory. First shown in 1973

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Alan Yentob's seminal documentary following the musician across America on his 1974 Diamond Dogs tour, at a time when his rock star excesses were at their most extreme. Originally shown as part of Omnibus in 1975, the film features revealing footage of Bowie and his fans, illustrating the effects of fame on musicians and their followers

programme.title: How the Wild West Was Won with Ray Mears
programme.desc: How the landscapes of America's five great deserts challenged the pioneers' westward push. Beginning in Monument Valley on the Arizona-Utah state line, Ray discovers how the US cavalry struggled in the hot arid landscape, explores how the Apache adapted their warfare methods to the hostile conditions and reveals why the forbidding landscape proved the perfect refuge for bandits

programme.title: Sir Simon Rattle at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of the conductor's finest performances from the BBC archive, featuring his work at the BBC Proms and demonstrating love of contemporary music

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's Scottish railway journey reaches Aberdeen. From the granite city, Michael heads out to Forvie National Nature Reserve, which is 1,000 hectares of protected coastal habitat dominated by grassy dunes

programme.title: Secrets of Skin
programme.desc: Ben Garrod explores how animals' skin acts as a barrier between them and the outside world, shielding them from extremes of temperature, harmful effects of UV and organisms

programme.title: Treasures of the Indus
programme.desc: Sona Datta examines the artistic legacy of the Mughal Empire, from the Taj Mahal to fabulously intricate miniatures of court life, and traces how it also sowed the seeds of discord

programme.title: Death Camp Treblinka: Survivor Stories
programme.desc: An insight into how Samuel Willenberg and Kalman Taigman escaped from the concentration camp in Poland, where more than 800,000 Polish Jews died during the Nazi Holocaust. The two men were able to flee during a revolt in August 1943, before one of them sought vengeance in the 1944 Warsaw Uprising and the other appeared at the trial of Adolf Eichmann for war crimes in 1961. This film documents their stories, the fate of their families and offers fresh accounts of a forgotten death camp

programme.title: Shadow of Truth
programme.desc: Documentary investigation into the murder of a 13-year-old Israeli schoolgirl in 2006. Tair Rada is found dead inside a locked toilet cubicle at her school. The police are under heavy pressure to find her killer and a suspect is arrested

programme.title: Shadow of Truth
programme.desc: Suspect Roman Zadorov retracts his confession, claiming he was coerced into it by the detectives. A month after his arrest, the trial for Tair Rada's murder begins

programme.title: Catching History's Criminals: The Forensics Story
programme.desc: An insight into the development of forensic science as a way of catching murderers over the past 200 years, charting the scientific breakthroughs that have changed the course of justice. Surgeon and writer Gabriel Weston begins by looking at the difficulty of identifying the body in a murder case, from charred bones to bodies completely dissolved in acid. She focuses on the use of teeth and bite marks to identify a victim or killer, traces the uses of insects to pinpoint the time of death, and meets the geneticist who pioneered the technique of DNA profiling

programme.desc: Zahra-Rose's family is from Somalia, a country situated on the east coast of Africa. In Somalia, they have the traditional dish of nafaqo, which is boiled egg wrapped in mashed potato. This is what Zahra-Rose has chosen to make for her friends. To begin with, Zahra-Rose seasons mashed potato with salt, black pepper, flour, ground cumin, ground coriander, turmeric powder and fresh coriander. She then wraps the potato mixture around her special ingredient, hard-boiled eggs, rolls them in breadcrumbs and puts them in the oven to be cooked. Zahra-Rose also serves a fresh chilli sauce, so her friends can use it for dipping. Not only does Zahra-Rose have beautiful decorations, she also has a surprise picnic planned. programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores the wildlife of Anglesey. Wales' largest island is renowned for its coastal beauty, but it also has stunning fenland and rich surrounding sea full of terrific wildlife. In this episode, Iolo heads out to sea to look for Risso's dolphins, where underwater, an artificial reef has formed from an old shipwreck. The presenter finds roosting bats at an old priory, plus dragonflies and beautiful rare plants on Anglesey's fens. On the Alaw estuary, Iolo gets a rare sight of a merlin - Britain's smallest bird of prey as well as Brent geese, which have flown all the way from Canada to overwinter on Anglesey

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor joins forces with his brother David and his uncle Matheson to try out landscape painting in the fresh air on the hunt for ways to relax that do not cost a fortune. programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a dog-loving couple from Hertfordshire to find a High Weald home, and also gets to grip picking some of the local grape harvest

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses by joining presenter Dom Chinea at a life-changing training camp in the grounds of a arts-and-crafts house in Leicestershire. In the first episode, Morgan's furniture is beautifully crafted, but he lacks the confidence to really sell it. Cath's life-sized fantastical willow woven creatures are unique - but are they saleable?

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: New recruit Mark Hill joins Roo Irvine on a hunt for collectables around Scotland, discovering a tale of 18th-century body snatchers and the origins of British sign language

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Gina comes under questioning when Linda finds out there is ¬£200 missing from the Vic's takings. Anna decides to go through with her decision to find her mum and Freddie decides to look for his dad after seeing Alfie throw a party for Bert and Ernie. Stacey and Eve hatch a plan to find her stalker

programme.title: BBC Wales Investigates
programme.desc: Wyre Davies investigates the case of 96-year-old Lily, who has been stuck in a hospital bed for 11 months. She just wants to go home, but her council cannot find carers to look after her. The programme discovers just how many other people there are like Lily, and reveals the wider impact that a shortage of carers is having - including on the NHS

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Photographer Brock Elbank takes images of Araf, Scotland's first Asian paramedic, who also works with local mosques and gurdwaras, equipping them with first-aid knowledge and providing a bridge between communities. Brock's photographic projects focus on idiosyncratic and unique features, such as scars, birthmarks and skin conditions such as vitiligo, to capture the private stories behind a public persona

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Thriller about a detective haunted by his brother's childhood disappearance, who becomes obsessed with the idea that his neighbour may have been responsible. Elsewhere, a family return to their rural Welsh home from London to be confronted with disturbing discoveries that have echoes of an infamous double murder committed in the area - and the possibility that someone intends to re-enact the killings

programme.desc: It looks like the end of the road for Freddy and Baba, trapped in a remote cottage by Lola, Jackson and a squad of armed response officers. programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Adam Henson are in the thick of hay-making season, discovering what makes one of the nation's oldest crops so special. Charlotte is put to work on the Lizard Peninsula in Cornwall by a farmer whose family have been making hay for more than 500 years and also gets the chance to see how harvest activity attracts and excites myriad creatures. Adam is at a polo match finding out how nutrients in high-end hay are helping horse owners to get ahead, and Tom Heap investigates how marine heatwaves are threatening the sea life that lives around our coastline

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Ham House in the London borough of Richmond-upon-Thames, where an 18th-century robe could be an important piece of Chinese history. Other items brought in include a portrait by Indian-born artist FN Souza, a collection of silver from the Gulf state of Oman, two goblets engraved with images of the Crystal Palace, a dressing gown made by from a blanket by a German prisoner of war, and a photo album that documents the moment British atomic bombs were tested in 1956

programme.title: World on Fire
programme.desc: The success of the Allied advance in Libya is undone when the Italian forces receive German reinforcements, leaving Stan and Rajib forced to beat a hasty retreat across the desert. Marga attends a maternity home and finds her commitment to the cause invigorated, despite an encounter with a traumatised fellow patient exposing her to some difficult truths. David is selected to fly a dangerous mission over France

programme.desc: Gay rights activists gather in London for a pride march in 1984, and decide they have a common cause with the miners' strike. programme.desc: Kate Humble and Ben Fogle are at Longleat Safari Park, getting ready to welcome five Southern koalas that are en route from Adelaide in Australia. Jean Johansson is in the wolf wood to see if the European grey wolves can live up to their reputation for having one of the best senses of smell in the animal world

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph visit a terraced house in Stoke-on-Trent, a semi-detached house in Chaddesden, Derby, and a five-apartment building in Chatham, Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine presents from the Antiques, Vintage and Collectors Fair in Detling, and finds out how retro computers are becoming collectable. With Irita Marriott and Nick Hall

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the post-war British modern art movement in the seaside town of St Ives, the home for leading artists such as Barbara Hepworth and Terry Frost. At the Lizard Peninsula, Rick heads out to sea to fish for red mullet, and on the wild coast at Land's End, he discovers why Cornwall has a rather unusual animal as its national emblem

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: The actor joins forces with his brother David and his uncle Matheson to try out landscape painting in the fresh air on the hunt for ways to relax that do not cost a fortune. A trip to an organised tree-top adventure park follows before they return to the family favourite of fly-fishing on a picturesque Northumbrian lake

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a dog-loving couple from Hertfordshire to find a High Weald home, and also gets to grip picking some of the local grape harvest

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses by joining presenter Dom Chinea at a life-changing training camp in the grounds of a arts-and-crafts house in Leicestershire. In the first episode, Morgan's furniture is beautifully crafted, but he lacks the confidence to really sell it. Cath's life-sized fantastical willow woven creatures are unique - but are they saleable?

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: New recruit Mark Hill joins Roo Irvine on a hunt for collectables around Scotland, discovering a tale of 18th-century body snatchers and the origins of British sign language

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Konnie Huq

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Gina comes under questioning when Linda finds out there is ¬£200 missing from the Vic's takings. Anna decides to go through with her decision to find her mum and Freddie decides to look for his dad after seeing Alfie throw a party for Bert and Ernie. Stacey and Eve hatch a plan to find her stalker

programme.title: A Stitch Through Time
programme.desc: It's elimination week as presenter Claire McCollum welcomes the four designers back to the design studio to face two cotton-based fashion challenges. First, the designers have 90 minutes to turn a selection of pre-loved cotton casuals into a standout skirt fit for the catwalk. Finally, the designers must create a power suit inspired by the Ulster-Scots entrepreneurs who introduced industrial cotton spinning to Belfast in the late 1700s

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Wolf
programme.desc: Thriller about a detective haunted by his brother's childhood disappearance, who becomes obsessed with the idea that his neighbour may have been responsible. Elsewhere, a family return to their rural Welsh home from London to be confronted with disturbing discoveries that have echoes of an infamous double murder committed in the area - and the possibility that someone intends to re-enact the killings

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: Documentary following Patricia Page, aka Rat Woman, who is on a mission to rid the homes, businesses and streets of Northern Ireland of the ratty rodents, cocky cockroaches and whacky wasps. For many this a man's job, but Patricia - one of the only female pest controllers in the country - is unfazed by this work . She has her sights firmly set on becoming a legend in her own right as she battles the most common form of pests terrorising the country

programme.title: Community Life Appeal
programme.desc: Vinny Hurrell presents an appeal on behalf of Northern Ireland Blind Golf, which promotes health and wellness and inclusion for the visually impaired and blind. At Donaghadee in County Down, he is shown some of the skills of being a golf guide. Members of Northern Ireland Blind Golf will explain how seeing golfers have been helping those with visual impairment and blindness to participate in the sport. He'll hear how some local people have had great success in the sport internationally

programme.title: We Hunt Together
programme.desc: It looks like the end of the road for Freddy and Baba, trapped in a remote cottage by Lola, Jackson and a squad of armed response officers. With the trail behind them strewn with bodies, it seems unlikely they will escape the reckoning. Psychological thriller, starring Eve Myles and Babou Ceesay

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts an extended episode, with comedian Ivo Graham and journalist Isabel Hardman joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Scandalous: Phone Hacking on Trial
programme.desc: A look at the bitter legal battle taking place for a decade over allegations of unlawful information gathering at some of Britain's biggest newspaper groups. Told through the testimonies of alleged victims who claim they were targeted unlawfully by the papers, including Sienna Miller, Hugh Grant, Steve Coogan, Heather Mills, Shobna Gulati and Simon Hughes, as well as private individuals who were caught up in the news, this documentary examines the evidence

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to actor and film-maker Kenneth Branagh In a wide-ranging conversation, Branagh reveals some of his most formative artistic experiences and his creative process. He remembers his working class upbringing in late 1960s Northern Ireland at the start of the Troubles, as explored in his most personal film to date, Belfast. Branagh also traces the beginnings of his love for Shakespeare back to the discovery of LP recordings of Laurence Olivier and John Gielgud, and reveals his admiration for Thomas Hardy and the Alan Bleasdale's 1980s television series The Boys from the Blackstuff

programme.desc: Spencer Kelly goes behind the scenes at CERN - home to the Large Hadron Collider and one of the largest scientific research centres in the world. programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Treubh an Tuathanais (Big Barn Farm)
programme.desc: The farmyard bunch try to find places in the shade where they can feel cooler, as the day is very hot and muggy

programme.title: Pip & Posy
programme.desc: The duo play a game together but Pip isn't happy when Zac, Jamila and Francaidh appear and Pip allows them to play the most fun parts of the game

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc: Augustin claims to have seen the famous beast that lurks by the lake. C√©lestine and her friends immediately ask Ernest to take them there

programme.title: Sionnach agus Maigheach (Fox & Hare)
programme.desc: Owl wants to enter a drawing contest but fears his work is not good enough and throws it away. Fox brings the discarded drawing to Hare and they decide to send it in secretly

programme.title: Aithne air Ainmhidhean (All About Animals)
programme.desc: Following the activities of Igby, a green iguana that has recently hatched from his egg. Cameras follow Igby as he digs his way out of his habitat and attempts to find his way through the jungle

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda
programme.desc: Shifu's father visits the Jade Palace, but Po is disappointed to learn that he and his son do not get along

programme.title: Am BFG (The BFG) (1989)
programme.desc: A friendly giant befriends a lonely little girl and transports her to a strange land. Unfortunately, a number of the other giants there have acquired a taste for eating children. Determined to stop their nefarious habit, the pair set out to charm the Queen of England into putting her armed forces at their disposal. Animated adventure, based on Roald Dahl's classic tale, with the voices of Donald Smith, Catriona Lexy Campbell and Donna Morrison

programme.title: Cearcall
programme.desc: Reports first aired on the series in the 1970s and 1980s. Subjects include the origins of fish farming on the West coast and the impact of a decline in fishing on Scalpay

programme.title: Leugh Mi (Book Show)

programme.title: An Lot (The Croft)
programme.desc: Sweeny is excited to see his tweed and reflects on the past 12 months, while also taking a look towards the future

programme.title: Belladrum
programme.desc: Fiona MacKenzie and Niall Iain MacDonald presents sets from the third night of the festival at the Belladrum Estate in Kiltarlity near Inverness, including performances by Travis, Peat and Diesel, Scouting for Girls, Pale Waves, Fatherson and Alabama 3

programme.title: Muhammad Ali: An Gasigeach
programme.desc: Muhammad Ali shocks the world when he defeats George Foreman in Zaire, but is diagnosed with Parkinson's in 1984 and continues to travel the world spreading his Islamic faith

programme.title: An t-Inneal Espresso/The Espresso Machine
programme.desc: Drama revolving around a high-end espresso machine. Ealasaid loaned her machine to Ailig's girlfriend Una, and desperately wants it back. Unfortunately, Ailig and Una just broke up

As the Cold War ended, scores of them were still operating in the UK. programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at autumn in the northern hemisphere and spring in the south, seasons of change that bring opportunities, but also huge challenges. By September temperatures in northern Canada can plummet as low as -20C, but there is one stretch of river that still flows and bears are able to fish for the final salmon of the season. In southern Africa the rains have been gone for many months and watering holes have all-but dried up, while a king penguin chick on Marion Island answers the call of the ocean

programme.title: The Stasi: Secrets, Lies & British Spies
programme.desc: For nearly 40 years, East Germany's Stasi was one of the most formidable secret police forces in the world, with a vast network of spies and informers reaching across the globe until the fall of the Berlin Wall. As the Cold War ended, scores of them were still operating in the UK. With access to recently opened court files, Julie Etchingham reveals some of the Stasi's UK operations and asks why the identities of many alleged British informers are still a guarded secret 30 years after Germany made its file public

Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.desc: Stephen Fry looks at autumn in the northern hemisphere and spring in the south, seasons of change that bring opportunities, but also huge challenges. By September temperatures in northern Canada can plummet as low as -20C, but there is one stretch of river that still flows and bears are able to fish for the final salmon of the season. In southern Africa the rains have been gone for many months and watering holes have all-but dried up, while a king penguin chick on Marion Island answers the call of the ocean
