Rural drama, starring James Carlton, Ian East, Peter Benson, David Lonsdale and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Alf Ventress mounts a large-scale surveillance operation in an effort to track down the wool thief responsible for de-fleecing sheep in Aidensfield. Bernie finds himself in hot water when an estranged son arrives to bury his father - who is already six feet under. Drama, starring James Carlton and Peter Benson

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Laurel and Ashley are finally reunited, Steph throws her weight around at the factory, while Zak consoles Terry with a few well-chosen words of wisdom

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Dawn reacts angrily to the discovery that Terry has lost his job, Laurel and Ashley get used to the idea of being a couple, and Syd catches Chloe trying to chat up curate Ethan

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve tries to make life difficult for Karen and Joe, but his actions only end up backfiring. Gail gets a call from her solicitor about her finances

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Gail is left devastated after a meeting with her solicitor. Steve hits rock bottom, having to endure Janice regaling him with tales of how happy Karen and Joe are together

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The apparent accidental death of a drug addict takes a surprising turn when the results of the post-mortem examination are revealed, and Jack finds himself confronting his own chequered past. Ewen Bremner guest-stars, with David Jason

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A serious assault leads the police to foil an attempt to steal antiques from Ashfordly Hall, and Vernon goes all-out to persuade a wealthy woman to make a charitable contribution toward his donkey sanctuary - but the discovery that there is already one in the area forces him to change his plans. Meanwhile, Merton devises a solution to Ventress's retirement worries. Rosemary Leach guest stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The Aidensfield police are puzzled when it seems a face from the past has become the unlikely victim of vandalism, and suspicions are soon aroused over the reasons for his sudden return to the village. Meanwhile, Vernon encounters dangerous wildlife as he stashes his capital in Ashfordly woods, but decides to turn the incident into another money-making scheme. Geoffrey Hughes stars

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: In the summer of 1967, Morse and Thursday are both devastated by Joan's abrupt departure from Oxford. The young detective responds to his loss by throwing himself into his work, investigating the suspicious drowning of a scientist who was part of a research team working on an early computer. At first it appears to be a simple suicide - until two more bodies are found in the river

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: DS Sam Casey, a young officer with a strong sense of justice, is brought in to investigate the shooting of Devlin outside the Old Bailey, and is surprised to learn the gunman was specifically targeting police officers. The case sees the whole team emotionally spent, with the trial itself at risk of being derailed by a politically driven defence lawyer (Colin Salmon) with an axe to grind. Crime drama, starring Bradley Walsh, Freema Agyeman and Paul Nicholls, who joins the cast

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The mysterious shooting of archaeology student Celia Dawe and the significance of matching playing cards lead Wycliffe on a manhunt across Cornwall. Police drama based on the novel by WJ Burley, guest starring Bill Nighy alongside Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on Adam over missing hospital funds and Mike attends a meeting to assess the mental welfare of a 50-year-old man (guest Andrew Dunn) who still lives with his mother. Elsewhere, Gordon's former father-in-law pays an unexpected visit with sobering news and Ken makes a confession to his colleagues. Guest starring Michael Jayston

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Jill becomes unwell after receiving the results of a pregnancy test. Elsewhere, when a baby goes missing, suspicion falls on the parents of a girl admitted with a broken ankle. Meanwhile, Gordon makes a discovery about a diabetic patient that explains his behaviour and, in a dramatic finale, tragedy looms. Daniel Casey guest stars

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon has a fall and badly cuts himself, being rushed to hospital for emergency treatment. Having the same blood group a very reluctant Oliver agrees to donate blood for a transfusion and goes on to make the most of the situation. Comedy, starring Windsor Davies and Donald Sinden

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Another chance to see the feature-length first episode of the popular detective drama. Inspector Jack Frost's investigation into the case of a missing child uncovers a skeleton chained to a locked strongbox that tantalisingly turns out to be empty, but provides evidence of a crime committed 30 years previously. David Jason stars as the irascible detective, with Bruce Alexander, Matt Bardock and Claire Hackett

programme.title: Carry On at Your Convenience (1971)
programme.desc: Production at toilet manufacturers WC Boggs is brought to a halt when an over-eager trade union representative calls a strike. However, worker unrest is quickly quelled by a jolly trip to the seaside. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Cope, Hattie Jacques, Joan Sims, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey and Bernard Bresslaw

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo are hired to investigate why newly planted roses at an upmarket preparatory school keep dying. After witnessing the arcane ritual of the Night of the Stag, they detect tensions between modernising headmaster Quentin Marshall and established members of his staff who are harbouring secrets someone is prepared to kill for. Drama, guest starring Anthony Andrews (Brideshead Revisited), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: David Jason returns as DI Jack Frost in this feature-length episode. Faced with the death of a police informant on an estate riven with racial tension, the detective finds his patience pushed to the limit. Bruce Alexander and Lennie James also star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours, including the hall's previous owner Dolly Bantry. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the star's unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The detective investigates the disappearance of a Dutch au pair, which seems connected to rivalry amid the city's academics. His search leads him to a family estate in the Oxfordshire countryside where he meets three siblings divided by personal demons and shared loss. Endeavour suspects there is a link between the disappearance and an unsolved case from years before, but as the investigation continues, conflict erupts between his fellow officers. When a group of teenagers makes a horrifying discovery, he suspects someone is manipulating events from afar

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of killings in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding, it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day 'sinners'. With help from sidekick Charlie Nelson, Barnaby tries to get to the bottom of the case, and unearths a long-held secret that takes him by surprise. With Rebecca Front, Andrea Lowe, Vincent Regan and Roy Hudd

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is discovered bound to a tree, doused in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads DCI Barnaby to tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron at the upmarket Wyvern House restaurant. However, secrets from the past surface after the murderer strikes again, and the repercussions are felt further than they were originally intended. With Neil Dudgeon, Neil McCaul, Sharon Small, Marc Elliott and Arabella Weir

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The detective is distracted from a string of attacks on three wealthy farms by a series of anonymous phone calls from a man who claims a gang is trying to kill him. He and his trusty associates LaPointe and Janvier go in search of the caller, which leads them to the discovery of a body that has been dumped out of a car. Maigret is convinced the corpse is the man who phoned him - but his face has been mutilated, making it impossible to confirm his identity. Rowan Atkinson stars

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet moves a step closer to tracking down Veronica's killer while investigating a recent murder that bears similarities to the cold case. Rachel finds out about an affair Nick once had with a juror in the middle of a trial - a revelation that could end his career. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp, Suranne Jones and Rupert Graves

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon wonder why Oliver has suddenly begun taking an interest in his younger sister Susan (guest star Prunella Scales). Comedy about rival antique dealers, with Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: Never the Twain
programme.desc: Simon and Oliver agree to undertake a stock check, but deceit and greed are the order of the day. Comedy, starring Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the crime drama. DI Frost has his hands full coping with death threats, arson and a staff shortage at the station - but anything is better than staying at home with an unwelcome guest. David Jason stars as the grouchy inspector, with Tony Haygarth, Diane Bull, Denise Black and Dominic Jephcott

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: The detective is paired with DC Webster, an officer who is struggling to fit in with life in Denton after being seconded from Scotland, with the duo investigating a robbery at a local casino and a hit-and-run incident involving Roger Massie, the son of a local politician, and soon finds that both matters are linked. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander and George Anton

programme.title: Carry On Matron (1972)
programme.desc: A wily thief gathers a band of crooks for a plot to break into a maternity hospital and steal the supply of contraceptive pills. One of the gang gets the lie of the land by disguising himself as a nurse, but the hypochondriac head doctor and formidable matron prove constant obstacles to the heist. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams and Hattie Jacques

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa worries Dr Timoney's suggestion that she and Martin aren't meant to be together might have prompted him to leave Portwenn for good. Calling on Ruth, Morwenna and Janice for help, she tries to track the down the missing GP, with no luck. However, what Dr Ellingham's friends and family fail to realise is that he is actually trapped up at the Winton farm, where desperate wife Annie is trying to coerce him into performing a life-saving operation on her terminally ill husband Jim. Meanwhile, Ruth and Bert seek out Al to offer him a proposition regarding the whisky and the B&B. Medical drama, starring Martin Clunes

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack finds himself working alongside DS Lawson on a delicate case involving a spate of attacks on defenceless senior citizens in their homes, while Lawson also offers him some advice on his personal life. David Jason stars, with Bruce Alexander, Sally Dexter and Neil Phillips

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuth helps an old friend find refuge at country house Greenshaw's Folly, but a sinister shadow falls over the strange building's various inhabitants and a murderer strikes. Miss Marple uncovers secrets from the past about Miss Greenshaw as a dangerous storm gathers and the bodies start to pile up. Julia McKenzie heads an all-star cast that includes Jim Moir (better known as Vic Reeves), Kimberley Nixon, Fiona Shaw, Robert Glenister, Julia Sawalha, Judy Parfitt and Matt Willis (formerly of pop group Busted)

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: An archaeologist posing as Rosemary dies mysteriously during a dig for Anglo-Saxon artefacts in the grounds of Lord Engleton's stately home, presenting the duo with a fresh mystery to solve. The gardens are unaccountably blighted by yellowing, forcing the estate to close its gates to the public, and a second death suggests somebody will go to any lengths for a piece of British history. Guest starring Julian Wadham

programme.title: The Larkins
programme.desc: The family goes to extreme lengths to persuade Mariette not to leave for France, while the glamorous Angela Snow arrives and sets tongues wagging, adding extra fuel to gossip started by the Normans. Pop and Ma have champagne-worthy news. Drama, starring Bradley Walsh and Joanna Scanlan

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: Joanna Lumley follows the Silk Road from the Black Sea to the Caspian Sea, travelling across the post-Soviet states of Georgia and Azerbaijan. From the seaside resort of Batumi, on Georgia's Black Sea, Joanna travels across the heart of the Caucasus region, passing through stunning mountain settlements, cities and vineyards, and finally the uber-modern city of Baku, the capital of oil-rich Azerbaijan. On the way she learns not only about the ancient Silk Road, but how these two very different countries are still finding their identities

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The detective is approached by a former mentor from his college days, who asks Morse to ensure the safety of his wife. However, the assignment leaves him contemplating his future with the police force. Meanwhile, a murder in the world of fashion stirs up old gangland conflicts in the city. Detective drama series, starring Shaun Evans as the young Inspector Morse

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hudson accompanies James on a shooting weekend and makes such an impression on the Newbury family that they offer him a position as their butler. Back at Eaton Place he writes to accept the job, but it appears he is needed much more than he realised in the Bellamy household

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A piano teacher (guest star George Costigan) remains suspiciously secretive about his past when brought in to casualty after collapsing outside the hospital. Matron's revelation about Susie cools Alun's interest in her, and Mike takes pity on a mother while he treats her son. Elsewhere, Jill delivers bad news to an elderly patient and the porters are forced to take industrial action in support of a colleague

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A train crash claims the life of an infant making Jill more determined than ever to support Carnegie's plans for a premature baby unit at the hospital. Meanwhile, local farmer Sam Benson (guest star Jack Deam) causes concern with his erratic behaviour, and Stella's rapist requires life-saving surgery after being attacked by the father of another victim

programme.desc: Panama v Jamaica (Kick-off 1.30pm). Coverage of the second match in Group F for both teams, held at Perth Rectangular Stadium in Australia. programme.title: Live British Touring Car Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the 16th, 17th and 18th races of the season, which come from Croft. Jake Hill is now third in the championship standings after picking up two race wins last time out at Oulton Park, Ash Sutton tops the drivers' standings after winning six races from the opening 15 rounds, and reigning champion Tom Ingram is just six points adrift of the three-time BTCC champion. Steve Rider presents, with commentary by David Addison, Tim Harvey, Paul O'Neill, Richard John Neil and Phil Glew, and reports from Louise Goodman

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade visits southern Africa to see if he can track down a deadly fish that lurks in the eerie waters of the Okavango. A killer with shark-like teeth, there are stories of it hunting in packs and feeding on schooling fish or even human bodies. Jeremy is determined to find out if it is a giant piranha or something equally terrifying

programme.title: Guns of the Magnificent Seven (1969)
programme.desc: Surviving gunslinger Chris is hired by Mexican revolutionaries to rescue their leader from a military prison. After assembling a crack team including a knife-fighting expert and a firearms aficionado, the group embarks on its mission - but underestimates the depths to which its enemies will sink. Second sequel to the Western, starring George Kennedy, James Whitmore, Monte Markham, Joe Don Baker and Reni Santoni

programme.title: Pale Rider (1985)
programme.desc: An unscrupulous landowner threatens to throw gold-miners off their land and take the riches for himself. As the law turns a blind eye to their troubles, the miners desperately need a saviour - who happens to arrive in the form of a mysterious preacher with formidable gunfighting skills. Western, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, alongside Michael Moriarty, Carrie Snodgress and Richard Dysart

Drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Christopher Carley and Bee Vang

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur is conned into buying an East German car, a retired greyhound and a piano. He fears the items could destroy his reputation, leaving him with the job of selling them on without the rest of the manor finding out. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole and Gary Webster

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: A youth is arrested after an elderly money-lender is brutally assaulted and robbed. His mother asks Regan, an old friend, to intervene. Though it is later proved he got a legitimate loan and is innocent of theft, the youngster finds himself being blackmailed after falling foul of some very dangerous individuals. Karl Howman guest stars, with John Thaw and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: A look behind the scenes at British brands, including an insight into how Yorkshire puddings are made on a huge scale, and life inside Britain's last remaining pencil factory. Plus, how one man's quest to make the perfect present for his dad ended with him producing handmade globes that are now in demand around the world. Narrated by Ricky Tomlinson

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur becomes concerned about security at the lock-up, and employs Ron the burglar to install the latest hi-tech alarm system. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole and Gary Webster

programme.title: FIFA Women's World Cup 2023
programme.desc: Costa Rica v Zambia (Kick-off 8.00am). Michelle Owen presents coverage of both teams' concluding Group C fixture, held at Wiakato Stadium in Hamilton, New Zealand. This is the first meeting between the two teams and they went into the tournament as underdogs to qualify given the strength of group rivals Spain and Japan. With analysis from Vicky Losada and Eni Aluko, and commentary by Pien Meulensteen and Siobhan Chamberlain

programme.title: First Blood (1982)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend

programme.title: Isle of Wight: Jewel of the South
programme.desc: It's Darcy Muncer's job to keep the island's hundreds of thatched properties looking top notch. Cameras follow him over a month as he restores an ancient, thatched roof, using skills and traditions that have remained unchanged for centuries. Meanwhile, in East Cowes, B&B owners Karl and David are preparing for the arrival of tourists Meryl and Dave from Wales

programme.title: When Fergie Met the Monarchy
programme.desc: If anyone should have been prepared for royal life, it was the Fergusons, with Prince Andrew and Sarah childhood playmates at Windsor Castle, and both families firm friends. This documentary examines the experiences of royal life for Sarah Ferguson and her family after she married Prince Andrew, and the impact on both sides after the marriage ended in scandal and divorce

programme.title: Buckingham Palace with Alexander Armstrong
programme.desc: The actor is joined by JJ Chalmers and Raksha Dave to reveal surprising stories about Buckingham Palace, examining the raucous balls thrown by first owners George III and Queen Charlotte, who purchased the residence as a rural retreat. Raksha gets glammed up Georgian-style to find out about the gossip and scandal that dominated the first parties hosted at Buckingham House, while Chalmers hits the dancefloor to trial some fancy footwork to impress the queen

programme.title: The Curse of Grace Kelly
programme.desc: A look at the privileged, but blighted lives of Princess Caroline, Prince Albert and Princess Stephanie, asking why they have been plagued by controversy and tragedy. Grace Kelly was killed in a car accident, and the ripples of such a devastating loss left their mark on all three of her children, including Caroline, who was thrust into first lady duties on the death of her mother, and has struggled to find happiness

programme.title: Greatest ABBA Cover Versions Ever
programme.desc: The stories behind well-loved versions of the Swedish group's songs, with music experts, fans and the performers themselves talking about what makes the originals so special. Featuring contributions by Dannii Minogue, Andy Bell of Erasure, Neil Arthur of Blancmange, Carla Bruni, Adrian Utley of Portishead, and producer William Orbit, who talks about a lost cover by Madonna.

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Flight
programme.desc: Documentary examining the royal family's history with air travel, from the first King's Flight in 1936 to the modern-day journeys undertaken by Queen Elizabeth II. Cameras step inside the private world of regal life in the air, uncovering the mysterious traditions and protocols behind royal travel, from the story of the Queen's Commonwealth tour in 1953 to the unique challenges presented in more recent times

programme.desc: Phoebe learns the truth about her father, while a malfunctioning radiator in Monica's apartment goes into overdrive, making her Christmas celebrations steamier than anticipated. Comedy, starring Lisa Kudrow and Courteney Cox

programme.desc: Dog handler Darren calls on all his powers of persuasion to try to end a roof-top stand-off, and Steve is forced to use his pepper spray when a suspect refuses to come quietly. Plus, there is a tense stand-off with a man armed with a knife

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Chris and the team are in pursuit of a stolen Mazda M3, but the driver disappears into an industrial area and tracker dog Ronny tries to track down the villain. Meanwhile, a routine stop and search takes a dangerous turn for Jimmy, and Liam helps take down a banned driver who causes carnage at a red light

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: Building works in the tower unearths some complete skeletons buried outside Henry VIII's chapel. Archaeologists examine the bones and attempt to uncover who these people were and how they came to be buried. Plus, the story of the tower during the Great Fire and a look at a handgun owned by Henry VIII, which provides an insight into the king's fascination with gunpowder weapons and its influence on the British war machine

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: The Tower plans its most ambitious installation for the first Platinum Jubilee in a thousand years and is turning the historic moat into a flower meadow

programme.title: Queen Victoria: In Her Own Words
programme.desc: Miriam Margolyes narrates an exploration of the queen's life through her diaries, journals and letters, as well as other items in the royal archives, revealing how she struggled to reconcile her different roles as monarch, wife and lover, as well as mother to a growing brood of children

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Dorset: Country and Coast
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh narrates a documentary exploring the rolling countryside, charming seaside towns and dramatic coastlines of Dorset, and examines the everyday lives of the people who live there, from locals to holidaymakers and farmers to wildlife conservationists. In the first episode, a 200-million-year-old fossil is found lying on a beach in Lyme Regis, and renowned chef and restaurateur Mark Hix MBE embarks on a fishing trip to catch sea bass to feature on his menu

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the secret of the supermarket chain's success. The programme examines the launch of a brand of organic food from Prince Charles' own duchy and reveals how the opening of a new Waitrose store has been known to boost house prices in the surrounding area. A taste test is performed to see how Waitrose's own brands compare to their rivals

programme.title: Million Pound Motorhomes
programme.desc: Simon and Julie take their daughter to Croatia for a cheerleading competition in their converted delivery van, while in America, Erick and Krystle show off their former bus, which inspired them to start their own conversion business for families with special sensory needs. Tomi Adebayo looks at three very different types of portable washing machines

programme.title: Coastguard: Search & Rescue SOS
programme.desc: A motor-powered yacht is in serious trouble off the south coast of England and the helicopter from Lydd in Kent is sent to help the two casualties on board the sinking vessel. A tanker is re-inspected by MCA surveyors in Teesport having been in dock for 15 days, while the Joint Rescue Co-ordination Centre in Fareham, Hampshire, receives a 999 call from a passer-by who can hear someone in distress under Bournemouth's Boscombe Pier

programme.title: Police: Hour of Duty
programme.desc: Officers rush to the scene of a fire at a block of flats, but when one resident fails to open their door, they are forced to take drastic action to avoid disaster. A high-octane police chase down a country lane has led to the arrest of a dealer who the police want to get off the streets, but when he refuses to comment under caution, will they have enough evidence to see him put away behind bars?

programme.title: Police Code Zero: Officer Under Attack
programme.desc: A single-crewed officer in north Wales spots a gang of suspected burglars making off in a powerful car, leaving PC Emma Birrell to give chase in a high-speed pursuit. In Hereford, police driving past a local nightclub spot a bouncer being verbally abused. They stop to help and PC Natasha Markham soon finds herself arresting the man, but he has no intention of going quietly and attempts to grab her crotch. When backup arrives, they take the man into custody, where the verbal abuse and assaults continue

programme.title: Surgeons: A Matter of Life or Death
programme.desc: Dan, 37, faces one of the hardest waits of his life. Diagnosed with primary sclerosing cholangitis - a disease that is causing his bile ducts and liver to fail - his only chance of survival is a liver transplant. A potential donor has been found, and now the race is on to assess the liver's viability. Once in surgery, Mr Bartlett works against the clock to quickly remove the old, diseased liver. But while trying to restore the blood supply to the new organ, there's a worrying lack of blood pressure

programme.title: 999: Emergency Call Out

programme.desc: After plummeting 15 feet onto concrete and his head taking the full impact of the fall, a man is rushed into resus with a significant laceration to his head. programme.title: Police Interceptors

Ken and Adam spot a shifty lad taking a sneaky photo of them on his phone and, when they stop him and his mate, they're clean, but the interceptors suspect they are at risk of child criminal exploitation

programme.desc: A group of wealthy friends from Guildford, who usually fly the globe together in search of sophisticated cultural experiences, take on a fast-paced budget Benidorm break. Meanwhile, party lovers from London who save every year to go to Benidorm together find themselves in the lap of luxury on a trip that sees them in the slowpaced confines of a five-star Caribbean hotel on the island of St Lucia. Each holiday is exactly what the respective groups normally avoid

programme.title: Never Teach Your Wife to Drive
programme.desc: Documentary following three women who are learning how to drive under instruction from their partners, with the drama and mayhem of the lessons putting added strain on their relationships. In Hertfordshire, Becky's tendency to put her foot down on the accelerator and severe lack of spatial awareness leaves Greg stressed out, while John begins by taking Yasmin out for endless spins around a car park in Wigan. In Guisborough, North Yorkshire, Matt's high levels of patience are tested as he teaches his hot-tempered wife Yaveli the rules of the road

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to would-be sellers in Cotham, Bristol, whose four-bedroom bungalow has been on the market for four months. She suggests revamping the shabby sitting room to enhance its ambience and updating the mismatched kitchen with a lick of paint, tile jewellery and new flooring, before turning her attention to sprucing up the two bathrooms

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: A Bollywood action movie is being filmed on the Indian railway and Thomas is desperate to be involved

programme.title: The Pink Panther (1963)
programme.desc: The world's most inept police detective, Inspector Clouseau, heads off to Switzerland in search of a suave jewel thief who has purloined a priceless diamond from a princess - but the bumbling officer's every ruse to foil the crime ends in chaos, not least when he is framed for the robbery himself. Blake Edwards' comedy, starring Peter Sellers, David Niven, Capucine, Robert Wagner and Claudia Cardinale

programme.title: Little Monsters (1989)
programme.desc: Brian is a lonely 11-year-old who's just moved to Boston with his family. He's having a hard time making friends in his new neighbourhood, and to make matters worse, he wakes up one morning to find he's being blamed for a stack of pranks that he swears he hasn't done. However, a blue-skinned monster called Maurice soon changes his life forever. Comedy, starring Fred Savage, Howie Mandel and Daniel Stern

programme.title: Monsters vs Aliens (2009)
programme.desc: A woman is exposed to radiation from a meteorite that causes her to grow to an enormous size during her wedding. She is captured by the military and held prisoner with an assortment of strange creatures - but when aliens invade, these freaks of nature are the only ones capable of saving the world. Animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Reese Witherspoon and Hugh Laurie

programme.title: Angus, Thongs and Perfect Snogging (2008)
programme.desc: A 14-year-old girl struggles to cope with the torments of growing up, fitting in and finding a boyfriend. Tired of being a social outcast, she plans to throw the perfect birthday party to win the respect of her peers. Comedy drama based on Louise Rennison's series of novels, starring Georgia Groome, Alan Davies, Karen Taylor and Aaron Taylor-Johnson

programme.title: Congo (1995)
programme.desc: An expedition to find King Solomon's diamond mines in the jungles of the Congo disappears without trace. The tycoon behind the mission sends his assistant, a former CIA agent, to find out what became of the explorers - only to discover that the party met a grisly fate at the hands of a horde of vicious apes. Action adventure based on Michael Crichton's novel, with Dylan Walsh, Laura Linney, Tim Curry and Grant Heslov

programme.title: Mean Girls (2004)
programme.desc: A teenager is surprised when she is befriended by the girls in the most popular clique at her new school. However, a dating mishap leads to trouble and her supposed friends start to turn on her. Urged on by other pals outside their circle, the newcomer resolves to bring down the self-appointed queen of campus - only to end up adopting some of her rival's crueller characteristics. Comedy, with Lindsay Lohan, Rachel McAdams, Tina Fey and Lacey Chabert

programme.title: Event Horizon (1997)
programme.desc: A deep-space salvage crew investigate mysterious events aboard a hi-tech spaceship, which suddenly reappeared in orbit around Neptune after going missing for seven years - but it is not long before they are exposed to terror beyond their wildest nightmares. Sci-fi horror, starring Laurence Fishburne, Sam Neill, Kathleen Quinlan, Joely Richardson and Sean Pertwee

programme.title: After Blue (2021)
programme.desc: Katarzyna Buszowska, also known as Kate Bush, is an outlaw on a post-Earth colony in space inhabited by women. Among them is Roxy, a teenager who is ordered to hunt Katarzyna/Kate down. Sci-fi fantasy, starring Paula-Luna and Agata Buzek. In French, with English subtitles

programme.title: The SpongeBob SquarePants Movie (2004)
programme.desc: The plucky sea creature sets out to prove his boss Mr Krabs is innocent of stealing Neptune's crown. However, the missing item has ended up in sinister Shell City, which all sea-dwellers fear and from which few have ever returned. Animated comedy, with the voices of Tom Kenny, Bill Fagerbakke, Clancy Brown and Scarlett Johansson, plus a cameo appearance by David Hasselhoff

programme.title: The Spiderwick Chronicles (2008)
programme.desc: Life for identical twins Jared and Simon and their sister Mallory begins afresh when their mother inherits a spooky mansion. But after moving in, strange things begin to happen, and as the youngsters investigate, they discover a book that opens up a mysterious world of amazing supernatural creatures. Fantasy adventure, starring Freddie Highmore in a dual role alongside Sarah Bolger and Nick Nolte

programme.title: The Art of Racing in the Rain (2019)
programme.desc: Thanks to his race car driver owner, golden retriever Enzo learns that the techniques needed on the racetrack can also be used to successfully navigate the journey of life. Comedy drama, starring Milo Ventimiglia and Amanda Seyfried

programme.title: Deep Impact (1998)
programme.desc: A TV reporter investigating a presidential misdemeanour stumbles on evidence that a comet is on a collision course with Earth, threatening the future of the human race. Meanwhile, an astronaut prepares to lead his crew on a do-or-die mission to intercept the danger. Sci-fi drama, starring Robert Duvall, Tea Leoni, Morgan Freeman and Elijah Wood

programme.title: Skyscraper (2018)
programme.desc: A former hostage negotiator takes a job as a security expert at the world's tallest building in Hong Kong. He finds himself framed for sabotage when the skyscraper bursts into flames. As he strives to clear his name, he must also fight his way back into the blazing tower to rescue his family, who are being held hostage by criminals 225 storeys up. Action thriller, starring Dwayne Johnson, Neve Campbell and Chin Han

programme.title: The Day After Tomorrow (2004)
programme.desc: A climatologist warns global warming will soon result in destructive freak weather, or even another ice age. He thinks the world still has time to prepare for the worst, but the crisis happens almost immediately - and as storms, earthquakes and hurricanes strike in terrifying fashion, he races across America to rescue his son from a frozen New York. Disaster thriller, with Jake Gyllenhaal and Dennis Quaid

programme.title: World War Z (2013)
programme.desc: A virus sweeps across the globe, turning everyone infected into mindless, ravenous zombies. As entire countries fall into chaos, a United Nations investigator sets off on a journey around the world to discover the cause of the pandemic and hopefully find a cure before human civilisation is brought to an end. Thriller based on the novel by Max Brooks, starring Brad Pitt and Mireille Enos

programme.title: Vivarium (2019)
programme.desc: Young couple Gemma and Tom are keen to buy their first home together, but when they do, things take a strange turn. Sci-fi thriller starring Jesse Eisenberg and Imogen Poots

programme.title: Muppets from Space (1999)
programme.desc: Gonzo hits the road with pal Rizzo in tow and goes in search of his roots - only to make the amazing discovery that his parents belonged to a race of aliens. He then has to choose whether to board a UFO and return to his family, or stay with the friends he knows and loves. Family comedy, with F Murray Abraham, David Arquette, Ray Liotta, Andie MacDowell and Rob Schneider alongside the puppets

programme.title: How to Train Your Dragon (2010)
programme.desc: A clumsy Viking boy longs to become a mighty dragon slayer and protect his village from the fearsome flying lizards, but his father thinks he is not up to the task. However, when he sets out to prove his worth, he ends up befriending a dragon, and realises his people may have misjudged the creatures. Animated fantasy, with the voices of Jay Baruchel and Gerard Butler

programme.title: The Man in the White Suit (1951)
programme.desc: A put-upon chemist's invention of an indestructible dirt-proof fibre brings him into conflict with clothing industry moguls who foresee their profits disappearing down the drain - and promptly vow to put a stop to his plans. Satirical Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood, Cecil Parker and Michael Gough

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad (1974)
programme.desc: A swashbuckling sailor stumbles across a golden tablet that forms part of a map revealing the way to a magic fountain, which is fabled to bestow untold riches and eternal youth. But first the brave mariner has to battle storms, monsters and the trickery of an evil wizard before he can reach his goal. Fantasy adventure, with John Phillip Law, Tom Baker, Douglas Wilmer, Martin Shaw and Caroline Munro, with effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: A Good Year (2006)
programme.desc: A city trader inherits a French vineyard from his deceased uncle. Ridley Scott's comedy drama based on Peter Mayle's novel, starring Russell Crowe, Albert Finney, Abbie Cornish and Marion Cotillard

programme.title: Underwater (2020)

She and a small crew fight for survival after a tremor causes catastrophic failures to the base's integrity. Meanwhile, in the inky void, something unspeakable lurks, waiting to attack. Sci-fi thriller, starring Kristen Stewart, Mamoudou Athie and Vincent Cassell

Director Jake Scott's drama, starring Sienna Miller, Christina Hendricks, Sky Ferreira and Kentucker Audley

They have set their sights on a traditional Spanish property with a modern twist, so will Jonnie be able to deliver?

programme.title: Bake Off: The Professionals
programme.desc: Liam Charles and Ellie Taylor challenge six new teams to produce 36 perfect Prinsesst√•rta alongside a chocolate amenity with no recipe to help them. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first host in Devon, 35-year-old salon owner Hannah, hopes to impress her guests with a menu bursting with taste sensations. But Hannah's technique of combining her favourite flavours may not tickle all of her foodie guests' taste buds. Hannah's night is filled with laughter and revelations, though there is an inkling around that her food is not tasty enough

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The second dinner party in Devon is hosted by funeral director and BMX fanatic Simon, who hopes his big portions and 'man food' will win him the cash prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Body artist Pascale hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Devon, preparing a Vietnamese menu full of flavour and colour in an effort to impress her guests enough to win the ¬£1,000 prize money. However, her cooking attire for the starter leaves little to the imagination, Nick and Simon find some unusual artwork in her bedroom, Hannah discovers an unwanted guest in her main course, and Nick hits a nerve with Ajay

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nick hosts the fourth night in Devon, preparing a menu that he hopes represents his personality - big, bold and brash - although after his argument with Ajay, he is planning on turning down the banter. However, salon owner Hannah is not impressed with Nick's venison main and ladybird-loving Pascale finds the portions a bit too big. But undertaker Simon is happy to polish off any leftovers - is Nick in with a chance of bagging the ¬£1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Estate agent Ajay hopes her nautical-themed evening will see her sail to victory on the fifth and final night in Devon. Along with a gigantic seafood spread, she has also laid on a boat trip around Torquay harbour. However, all does not go quite to plan in the galley. The guests later gather to discover who has won the ¬£1,000 prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Simon White and Shirley Boyle, owners of the Old Hall Country House in Madeley, Cheshire, host the week's first round of the B&B competition. The guests are impressed by the 16th-century building, and are taken tap-dancing and to a private fine-dining restaurant, but one of them is dissatisfied with her bedroom's layout and the garnish on her eggs at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eileen Finn invites her fellow contestants to the four-star Thornley House in Allendale, Northumberland, for the second round of the contest, but struggles to follow the impressive first event. The hostess's pet cats are not to all of her guests' liking, and with activities including a tour of a feline cemetery, the theme for the stay is made abundantly clear

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jessica and Adrian Rashleigh are the third hosts, at their three-bedroom establishment Chy Conyn in St Ives, Cornwall. For the activity they arrange a magical mystery camper van tour of the local sights. Some of the guests struggle with the small breakfast room but the food is a success, and Eileen Finn demonstrates her karate skills on the men

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at the Cavendish in Bournemouth, run by Tim and Karen Sturgess. On arrival, the competitors are impressed by the 'pink palace', but things go downhill when a bed is broken and one couple are allocated a room next to the front door. However, Eileen is delighted by the feline memorabilia in her room and the group enjoys a spot of indoor paint-balling and an open-top bus tour of the resort

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Simon White of Old Hall Country House is surprised by an overpayment and Eileen Finn from the four-star Thornley receives tough criticism, before the winner is announced

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: Mark Evans meets more people who aspire to live in their ultimate waterside dream home. Simon and Mary Sparrow live on a barge in Beccles, Suffolk, with their son Nate and their two cats. The Sparrows have been running a boatyard for nearly 10 years, specialising in refurbishing and renting out floating homes to holidaymakers. Now they're designing and building a new, one-of-a-kind floating home for themselves - a futuristic-looking floating pod, drawing on a budget of ¬£70,000

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: Bettany heads to Cyprus, where she explores Aphrodite's cult and visits her sanctuary at Palaepaphos, and also discovers stunning Byzantine churches linked to the Crusaders in the Troodos Mountains. Finally, Bettany is granted special access to archaeological treasures in the UN Buffer Zone, a no-man's land that has divided the island since the 70s

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The medical team faces a range of sport and drink-related injuries on a busy Saturday, including two women hurt when the bar they were dancing on collapsed, and a bricklayer badly cut in an attempted mugging. The night's most dramatic case occurs when a father and son are brought in with life-threatening injuries after being attacked by gatecrashers at a family birthday party, one of whom was armed with a samurai sword

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The A&E staff of King's College Hospital in London treat patients involved in accidents, including a construction worker who broke his leg in three places and suffered injuries to his chest after being trapped under a cherry picker. Plus, a man who fell from a ladder and landed on his head, and a widower who had a nasty encounter with a mandoline while chopping vegetables

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr invites Sean Lock and Isy Suttie to go up against Jon Richardson and Richard Osman in the comedy words-and-numbers quiz. Alex Horne and the Horne Section join resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Sean Lock and Joe Wilkinson take on Jon Richardson and Sara Pascoe in the words-and-numbers quiz, while Sam Simmons joins wordsmith Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. Hosted by Jimmy Carr, with Rachel Riley looking after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The medical team faces a range of sport and drink-related injuries on a busy Saturday, including two women hurt when the bar they were dancing on collapsed, and a bricklayer badly cut in an attempted mugging. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The A&E staff of King's College Hospital in London treat patients involved in accidents, including a construction worker who broke his leg in three places and suffered injuries to his chest after being trapped under a cherry picker. programme.title: Food Unwrapped

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: Tim and Emily fell in love with their 16th-century, Grade II-listed Cotswold cottage on first viewing, despite an abundance of dark beams, low ceilings and woodchip. For George, the project is his oldest house yet. And In Kent he tackles an oast house. Can he design a super cool bedroom for eight-year-old Bella in this unusual tower?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Flamboyant 49-year-old performing arts teacher Helen gets the party started in Sheffield. Her cooking doesn't go to plan, but she certainly delivers on the entertainment, on a whirlwind evening featuring trumping, spies and a dessert that goes with a bang

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Design and technology teacher Claire hosts the second day of the competition in Sheffield, and hopes her Asian-inspired menu with a spot of clay model-making will impress her fellow diners enough to net her the points she'll need to secure the cash prize. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Service administrator Monika hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Sheffield. However, some of the guests are unsure about her Bulgarian delicacies, and the host must fight for control when the two teachers go head to head and when Simon makes sexist jokes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: After tensions arose between Claire and Helen on Monika's night, 1980s musician Ivor is determined to serve up some fun on his evening in Sheffield. He stages an '80s extravaganza, including a live performance from his new romantic band My Pierrot Dolls

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former chef Simon hosts the final meal in Sheffield, but is unlikely to get an easy ride from his guests following all the criticism he has dished out at the earlier soirees. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Teresa and Clive, owners of the Butterfly Guest House in Porthcawl, south Wales, host the next round of the competition, but their status as beginners is confirmed when one couple find hairs in the bathroom. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Kalpana and Joseph's four-star townhouse in Blackpool, the Address. Cumbrian farmers Ruth and Mike are unhappy their room overlooks a car park and security light, and a trip to the Pleasure Beach results in Teresa calling Mark and Kathy a miserable couple

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competitors head to Cumbria to visit Mike and Ruth's four-star gold-rated Crake Trees Manor. Two of the guests are looking forward to their stay in the plush building, until they discover they have been allocated outdoor accommodation without electricity, water or a toilet

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. Mark and Kathy of Godshill Park Farm receive some underpayments, and accusations of game-playing abound before the week's winner is announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

Alliances are quickly forged when David and Tina discover they both love a good gossip, before they turn their attention to Stephen when David compares him to a tramp. However, cracks were already beginning to show in the diners' genial facade yesterday, and the hostess realises she must play peacemaker if she is to keep everyone from falling out

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Call centre complaints officer and part-time farmer Stephen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham. programme.desc: Prison transport officer Tina is the fourth host in Co Durham. programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit Witney in Oxfordshire, where Henry comes across a tractor that has not run for quite a few years - but poses no problem for restorer Alan

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers are asked to track down the relatives of a Lancashire farmer who died without leaving a will. Plus, the story of a search for heirs that involved two generations of women who had played invaluable roles on Britain's production lines

programme.desc: The probate detectives try to find the relatives of a deceased Sidcup woman after she left behind a property in south-east London, but no will. Plus, the hunt for a former political correspondent's family reveals the story of a talented man who enjoyed an illustrious career

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group sets off for Great Yarmouth to stay in Sue Dodd's dog-friendly Seashells Guesthouse. Spirits run high with a trip to the beach and a game of bingo, but Nancy's complaints over dog hairs on the sheets and smoking in the rooms bring down the light-hearted mood during dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Paul Billington is annoyed that the bed he and wife Flora Loizou are given is not big enough, but is more impressed when taken for food at a quirky local restaurant

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests stay with Caroline Scott, the owner of the Dean B&B near Longniddry, East Lothian The picturesque house and breathtaking views across the Firth of Forth win everyone over, but underwear in the drawers, cobwebs on the curtains and a messy breakfast service seriously hamper the host's chances of success

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Spider monkey Kiara becomes a mother for the first time, but keepers worry that the baby is becoming weak as Kiara appears to be more interested in playing with the other monkeys than taking on maternal responsibilities. programme.desc: A saluki puppy called Harry has the cutest kangaroo jumps, but it remains to be seen whether he will prove the perfect pooch for Charlie and Ali. programme.desc: Kevin McCloud visits a couple planning to build a home that looks like a work of art overlooking a valley in south Devon. It will also be complicated to build and equally as expensive. programme.desc: Cameras reveal what can go wrong when a dream holiday turns into a nightmare. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A man is brought in with stomach pains and a suspected abdominal aortic aneurysm. programme.title: Rick Stein's Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef heads to Berlin, where history and the avant garde dwell side by side. A city that once made history with its divisive wall and Checkpoint Charlie now teems with an overwhelming array of innovative chefs offering delicious seasonal creations, such as pureed sunflower seeds, Jerusalem artichoke flans and crushed frozen pine nuts. Loved by the likes of Greta Garbo, Charlie Chaplin and Auguste Escoffier there's still a cornucopia of choice for those with a more traditional temperament with eisbein, meatballs and sausages topping every menu in the German capital

Aboard a paddle steamer on the lower Mississippi, Michael hears about the life of former river boat captain Samuel Clemens, better known as Mark Twain, and in Memphis, Tennessee, uncovers the story of a devastating epidemic. programme.title: The World at War

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.desc: The first destination of the week is the Grange Boutique Hotel in Grange-over-Sands, Cumbria, where guests complain of stifling rooms and eggs that are not up to standard

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Ruth and Lucy Hinch welcome their rivals to Rutland Luxury Lodges in Greetham, where the guests are relieved to find luxury in abundance - and Laurence is impressed with the stand-out breakfast sausage. However, something is missing for Simon

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Laurence and Danny Bowes welcome their guests to the Leicester Arms in Penshurst, Kent, and while some get a spotless welcome, Jackie and Nigel make a few dirty discoveries

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit of the week is to Weston-super-Mare in Somerset and Oakover Guesthouse, owned by former banker Simon Robinson and partner Ann Wilson. Most guests are delighted by the d√©cor, but Lucy and Ruth get a frosty reception. In the afternoon, some guests reveal their competitive side with all the fun of the fair. But come morning, Jackie and Nigel's noses are put out of joint as a bad smell disturbed their sleep. During feedback some feathers are ruffled

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to trade feedback. The guests cover their disappointment at the eggs for breakfast, dirty rooms and complaints about being kept awake at night, as well as criticising one owner's strategy

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps house-hunters Jo and Graham find their dream holiday home in Mar Menor, Europe's largest coastal lagoon, on Spain's Costa Blanca

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Serial renovators Lynn and Kerry cannot decide between starting a new project in the Chelmsford area where they currently live, or building a snorkelling business in Majorca, Spain. Sara Damergi and Jasmine Harman try to help them make a decision as they view properties in both regions

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Recently retired couple Nick and Jane Purser are looking forward to settling down, but cannot decide where that should be. Jane's mother lives in Liverpool, so she would prefer to stay close by with a move to Lancaster. Nick wants them to move to southern France, where he can ride his motorbike in the sun. Jasmine Harman shows the pair three properties in Lancaster for up to ¬£180,000 and Jonnie Irwin tempts them with three properties for up to ¬£145,000 in France

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Welsh champion sausage-maker Steve and his wife Helen have travelled the world in search of the perfect holiday home and have decided that Torrox on the Costa del Sol is for them. Scarlette Douglas pulls out all the stops to show five properties within her budget of ¬£95,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: When her partner of 20 years died, Ginny Lunn decided to find a holiday home where she could create new memories. Torn between buying a place in Dorset within easy reach of her London home for a budget of ¬£250,000, and the Costa Tropical in Spain, where she would have a budget of ¬£150,000, she requires help. Jasmine Harman shows her three options in Dorset, and Laura Hamilton tries to impress her with three properties in Spain, but, with the help of her sister Sara, which one will Ginny choose?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Steph, who works in recruitment, and Gordon, a recently retired insurance broker, have been married for 33 years. Now that their three children are all grown up, they've decided it's the perfect time to buy a holiday home close to a golf course. Laura Hamilton searches for a suitable property in the popular resort of La Mata on Spain's Costa Blanca, on a budget of ¬£125,000.

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Married couple Dexter and Aaron are looking for a fluffy, chunky dog. Ellie the chihuahua will have to prove that being neither fluffy or chunky isn't a problem when it comes to being their perfect match. Yoga teacher Venessa and son Jacob try to assess whether there is a bond between them and Zoe, a friendly beagle who has been trying to sniff out a new home for a while. Plus, Stanley the anxious Staffie meets 'dog-mad' pair Linda and Richard

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Retrospective edition recalling series highlights from 2022. The line-up of famous faces includes Rylan, Gyles Brandreth, Joanna Lumley, Tom Allen, Rob Beckett, Mo Gilligan, Babatunde Aleshe, Denise Van Outen, Duncan James, Sophie Ellis-Bextor, Zoe Ball, Shaun Ryder and Bez. They comment on shows including Love Island, Platinum Party at the Palace, The Savoy, Spooked Scotland, Saturday Night Fever, Big Boys and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire: Soccer Aid Special

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A night out ends badly when a young man is involved in a fight. A patient who has diabetes collapses with blood sugar levels that the paramedics say are as the highest they've ever seen. Paramedics suspect the barking cough of a toddler is the classic sign of croup, and an intoxicated man with a deep gash to his head needs stitches but first, they need to wrestle a bottle of alcohol from his grasp

programme.title: Our Guy in Colombia
programme.desc: Part two of two. Guy Martin continues his tour of the country's secret side by trying his hand at a semi-illegal cycling sport, where the goal is to drop down the steepest mountain roads as quickly as possible on modified bikes, using extra weight to go faster. After climbing onboard a drug cartel's smuggler narco-submarine to see how it could be built in a jungle workshop, Guy gets face to face with a drug dealer and former employee of Pablo Escobar

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff at Queen's Medical Centre in Nottingham are concerned that an 80-year-old man who fell out of bed and hurt his head may have incurred brain injuries. Other patients include a 22-year-old professional carer who has been brought into A&E after collapsing at work and a man who trapped his finger in a container. Plus, nurse Jess talks about her stammer

programme.title: Sky Coppers
programme.desc: The team join the search for a woman who has left a suicide note and vanished into the night. And officers are shocked when they arrive at a house to discover a gang cruelly breeding 'dangerous' dogs in horrific conditions

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on Frozen Planet II, Ninja Warrior UK: Race For Glory, Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?, Married at First Sight UK, the BBC news special announcing the Queen's death, the King's address to the nation and ITV News reporting Princes William and Harry on walkabout

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: A look back at some memorable moments of bad behaviour at Chester Zoo. With animals originating from 150 different countries, some of the zoo's species tend to be more of a handful than others. Chester's troupe of West African chimpanzees have a reputation for behaving badly, which 21-year-old Pattie lives up to. Kendari, a babirusa, shares her habitat with a pair of noisy short-clawed otters. The otters are rehoused alongside the Bornean orangutans, and more trouble follows. Meanwhile, Natasha the orchid mantis has eaten all the male mantises in the zoo - except for Bruce

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Sherbourne House Hotel in Attleborough, Norfolk, where some of the guests find the rooms a little too hot - resulting in some unwelcome feedback

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Training guru Steve Carlyle hosts the first party in York, but a sophisticated evening, complete with a butler, does nothing to boost his reputation as he competes to win the ¬£1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Trevor Rooney, who leads tours of supposedly haunted sites in York, hosts the second dinner party in the city at a bric-a-brac warehouse. He also has several spooky surprises in store for his guests, including a magic show, a paranormal-themed menu and a ventriloquist's doll that spends the evening flirting with the female diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third dinner party in York is hosted by Annie Albericci, who hopes to bring peace, love and harmony to the table with her festival-chic-themed evening. However, things go from bad to worse for Annie when the male guests find a racy photo of her

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Yvonne McGill hosts the fourth dinner challenge in York and goes for a 1960s-themed party, including a game of Snog, Marry, Avoid? and a Beatles tribute band. Meanwhile, guest Steve reveals his celebrity crush

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Foodie Rebecca Ryan hosts the final dinner party in York, and hopes to impress her guests by throwing a Hollywood-themed evening of glitz and glamour, before the winner of the ¬£1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Chateau DIY

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Irum and her husband Murtaza have a family nest egg to invest in a property, but need to decide whether they want to stay close to their Midlands base or relocate to the Costa Almeria in Spain. Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin show the couple what they could buy in each location

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Businesswoman Karen would like to invest in a property and has a flexible budget of ¬£280,000. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: In 2003, Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp were tasked with finding homes that would bring two pairs of lovebirds together. programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Lysette and Nigel Offley, who are knocking down an old Thames boathouse and constructing a cutting-edge home in its place. Taking inspiration from the river itself, they have designed a building of waves and curves with a huge glass porthole for a roof light. But problems begin almost from the start, as they cannot find a contractor willing to build over the water, their architect leaves unexpectedly and the costs turn out much higher than expected. To make matters worse, the neighbours are not happy about such a radical sight in their traditional community. As they begin to compromise, Kevin wonders if the couple's dreams will ever be realised

programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: How Hitler used bombs, dummy aircraft and an escape hatch to help him survive

programme.title: Castle Builders
programme.desc: How castles changed from being siege-proof fortresses to places of ceremony and fantasy, with reference to the rebuilt Windsor Castle as a notable example

programme.title: The Rocking Horse Winner (1949)
programme.desc: A boy develops a knack for predicting racing results while riding his toy horse, but his talents are abused by his greedy mother, ultimately leading to tragedy. Drama, starring John Mills, Valerie Hobson and John Howard Davies

programme.title: The Waterbabies (1978)
programme.desc: A runaway chimney sweep flees from his wicked master and stumbles across a strange underwater kingdom. As he tries to return to his own world, he discovers he must first save a group of water babies from a deadly foe. Children's adventure based on the novel by Charles Kingsley, starring James Mason, Billie Whitelaw and Tommy Pender

programme.title: The Trap (1966)
programme.desc: A woman is sold to a trapper in 19th-century British Columbia and reluctantly becomes his wife, overcoming her initial fears to nurse him through an illness. Drama, starring Oliver Reed, Rita Tushingham and Rex Sevenoaks

programme.title: The Cup (2011)
programme.desc: Australian jockey Damien Oliver prepares to follow in his father's footsteps and compete in the 2002 Melbourne Cup. However, the weeks leading up to the event are rocked by tragedy for both Oliver himself, who faces a death in the family, and for the nation in the wake of the Bali bombings. Fact-based drama, starring Stephen Curry and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: The Great Way
programme.desc: Alba and Raul start their journey around the world greatest walking trails, a journey that will take them from Japan to Peru, passing through the United States

programme.title: The Lion Queen
programme.desc: New arrivals put added pressure on limited resources as two rescued lions arrive at Glen Garriff. A male, called TJ, is unwell and requires the vet, while a cub is mauled by one of the lions

programme.title: Everything Must Go (2010)
programme.desc: A man's heavy drinking costs him his job and leads to his wife kicking him out of the house. He sets up home on their lawn, amid all the possessions she has thrown out, and to avoid seeming homeless, he begins selling them, leading him to make new friendships with his neighbours and gradually straighten out his life. Comedy drama, starring Will Ferrell and Laura Dern

programme.title: Tales That Witness Madness (1973)
programme.desc: A psychiatrist recounts four disturbing cases to a colleague, from a boy with an imaginary tiger to a cannibal luau organised by a literary agent. Director Freddie Francis's horror anthology, starring Donald Pleasence, Jack Hawkins and Kim Novak

programme.title: Jeffrey (1995)
programme.desc: A gay man living in New York at the height of the Aids epidemic becomes celibate out of fear of catching the disease. When he falls for a man who is HIV positive, he is forced to confront his fears concerning both love and mortality. Comedy drama, starring Steven Weber, Patrick Stewart and Sigourney Weaver

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of the amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: News Rewind
programme.desc: A digest of news and events from across London from the past few days.

programme.title: Talking Points
programme.desc: 'Current affairs affecting Londoners today and a look at the latest shows and films in the capital.

programme.title: London's Weekend
programme.desc: A chance to catch up on the week's headlines and a taste of what to see and do in London this weekend.

programme.title: Two Men in a Boat Chasing Spring
programme.desc: Jeremy Norman and his partner Derek Frost charter a motor yacht and set out on an amazing journey, chasing spring up the west coast of the British Isles

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Aging in the Wild
programme.desc: Documentary revealing what it is like for animals to grow old, looking at longevity, reproductive health, social status, wisdom and eventual death, as well as examining the unique challenges every species face in the ageing process

programme.title: The Great Way
programme.desc: Alba and Raul start their journey around the world greatest walking trails, a journey that will take them from Japan to Peru, passing through the United States

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton crosses the Sea of the Hebrides to explore the Shiants, once owned by Compton Mackenzie, the author of Whisky Galore. He then heads east to the romantic Isle of Ewe, before taking a kayak trip to the Summer Isles, where he samples a seaweed feast, and on to the cliffs of Handa

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton visits Islay, travelling from Finlaggan - where the famous ruler Somerled once held court - along the windswept coast, through its historic ports and villages to end on its highest mountain. Along the way he joins dedicated locals keeping the seafaring traditions of the island alive, discovers the secrets of Islay's illicit whisky distilling past and climbs Ben Vicar for a breathtaking view across the Hebrides

programme.title: A Kiss Before Dying (1956)
programme.desc: A psychopathic college student is horrified to learn his girlfriend is pregnant, threatening his chances of being accepted into her well-to-do family. In a fit of fury, he murders her and makes it look as if she had committed suicide - only for her sister to show up, taking an uncomfortable degree of interest in the manner of her sibling's death. Thriller, with Robert Wagner, Joanne Woodward, Jeffrey Hunter and Mary Astor

programme.title: The Captive Heart (1946)
programme.desc: A concentration camp escapee assumes the identity of a dead British captain, only to be captured by German forces in the aftermath of Dunkirk. To help maintain the deception while being held as a prisoner of war, he begins a correspondence with the real officer's widow. Second World War drama, starring Michael Redgrave, Jack Warner and Rachel Kempson

programme.title: Brighton Rock (1947)
programme.desc: A baby-faced teenage gangster charms an impressionable waitress into providing him with an alibi for a murder - but she falls head over heels in love with him, leading to his ultimate downfall. Thriller, based on Graham Greene's novel, starring Richard Attenborough, Hermione Baddeley, William Hartnell and Carol Marsh

programme.title: The Waterbabies (1978)
programme.desc: A runaway chimney sweep flees from his wicked master and stumbles across a strange underwater kingdom. As he tries to return to his own world, he discovers he must first save a group of water babies from a deadly foe. Children's adventure based on the novel by Charles Kingsley, starring James Mason, Billie Whitelaw and Tommy Pender

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: A new planet is sighted, and after holding a seance one of the Moonbase crew becomes convinced it is habitable and tries to force Commander Koenig to evacuate all Alphans to live there. Sci-fi adventure, with Martin Landau

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: Steed heads north to investigate a mysterious laird, who he believes is responsible for fish disappearing from the Scottish coast - and maybe the dead diver found stretched on a rack. Patrick Macnee stars

programme.title: Jack & Sarah (1995)
programme.desc: A lawyer's life is turned upside down by his wife's death in childbirth, leaving him to pick up the pieces and raise their daughter with the help of an unconventional American nanny. This emotional romantic comedy strikes a fair balance between sentiment and slush. Richard E Grant, Samantha Mathis, Judi Dench and Ian McKellen are among the experienced cast

programme.title: Everything Must Go (2010)
programme.desc: A man's heavy drinking costs him his job and leads to his wife kicking him out of the house. He sets up home on their lawn, amid all the possessions she has thrown out, and to avoid seeming homeless, he begins selling them, leading him to make new friendships with his neighbours and gradually straighten out his life. Comedy drama, starring Will Ferrell and Laura Dern

programme.desc: A girl treated as a drudge by her family lifts herself from her environment by becoming a housekeeper. Drama, starring John Mills, Carol White and Stuart Wilson

programme.desc: Yvonne throws Gary out, while Phoebe grows suspicious. Ron has a new girlfriend, but worries she is out of his league

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe

programme.title: Monkey

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: The Alan Clark Diaries
programme.desc: Mired in a hopeless affair with his mistress, Alan's marriage to Jane suffers and eventually begins to disintegrate. Part of The Thatcher Years strand

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Bankside and East Dulwich for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The Informers (1963)
programme.desc: The murder of a Scotland Yard informer starts a trail of deceit and intrigue among London's underworld, prompting a police inspector to conduct his own unorthodox investigation. Thriller, starring Nigel Patrick, Margaret Whiting, Colin Blakely and Derren Nesbitt

programme.desc: Mired in a hopeless affair with his mistress, Alan's marriage to Jane suffers and eventually begins to disintegrate. Convinced his career is going the same way, he resigns just before the 1992 general election, but struggles to cope with life in the political wilderness. John Hurt and Jenny Agutter star. Part of The Thatcher Years strand

programme.title: Hound (2017)
programme.desc: An alcoholic loner is snapped out of his misery when his faithful dog is murdered by a local gangster. Overcoming his addiction, he transforms his life by mastering martial arts, then puts his skills to use seeking vengeance. Crime thriller, starring Sacharissa Claxton and Neal Ward

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: Investigating the Nazi leader's armoured train, which was able to bring German railways to a halt

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings

programme.title: EFL Cup Retro
programme.desc: Manchester United v Tottenham Hotspur in the 2008/09 final. Spurs were managed by Harry Redknapp and had a strong run that led them to the final of the competition, having beaten the likes of Newcastle, Liverpool and Watford in previous rounds. The Red Devils had beaten Middlesbrough, Queens Park Rangers and Blackburn Rovers in the early rounds, before beating Derby County 4-3 on aggregate
